pros: the best part of the job is how rewarding  the work is- the kids at boys and girls clubs NEED the staff- for many it is their family and only source of positive attention.
cons: Empolyees are overworkd and severly underpaid. Big clubs with central offices off site are tough to work for. people far away being paid a lot more money make policy decisions without input from front line staff. this tends to alienate good staff who really care about the mission. it pushes away the best qualified staff to pursue employment where they have more influence.

review_title: Positions at the Boys and Girls Club
pros: This a great place to get started in  non profit work if you are ok with the pay and the legnth of time it takes to get a promotion.
cons: There seems to be a direct link between the UNit Director getting a pay raise and getting fired. Every two years when someone is up for a raise it seems as though there is a reason found to fire them. This may not occur in all boys and girls clubs but it certainly seems to be the way in the on I worked in.

review_title: It was good, but could use improvements for more retention
job_title: Youth Development Professional in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
- Working with kids
- Field trips across the city twice every week(during the summer)
cons:
- We were required to plan the entire 3 months of summer programming, but there was always some issues with implementation: lack of communication, manager not present, no consistent weekly meeting for briefing and reflection
- there is almost always new employees every summer, and from what i've known from other colleagues, they didn't like the management at all. There was a bottle neck in terms of budgeting and spending through our manager, also delegation and the level of authority we have. 
- the staff didn't know when to handle situation on their own (when there is an issue with a kid) vs when to call the director or manager

pros: 1) Perfect for my schedule while in the community college.  2) There was some training. 3) Hard working staff. 4) mostly nice children. 5) I could run some planned activities if I wanted to. 5) Culture and values were good for the children.
cons: 1) The director got a promotion and left, they hired a weak replacement. 2) The owner had a system of evaluation that gave low grades in order to not to give a salary rise. 3) I did  not see room to grow; I felt the director wanted to 'keep me in my place' and denied me an opportunity to get involved in the community work. Another staff was repressed when he applied to be the new director. 4) Culture and values not good for staff.

pros: I love that there are so many opportunities for children to learn, have fun and be safe. I loved the opportunity of meeting so many people from multiple economic and social backgrounds.
cons: For me, it was the lack of pay! Hadn't had a raise in three years. I loved my job but I could not afford to stay.  I worked REALLY hard on helping the children/families while managing the front office but I could barely afford to make it to work. I loved the challenge of it all!

review_title: A great place to get experience working with youth if you're heart is in it.
pros: Lots of interactions with youth, field trips, involvement in the community, casual dress. The kids are the best part, building relationships with them and seeing them grow is the biggest perk.
cons: Demanding schedule, emotionally tiring, low pay. It's not a high-paying job whatsoever, especially for the work you put in. The reward is not monetary. Some administrative staff is difficult to work with because they don't seem to understand how much they ask of the staff at their clubhouses and leave them feel vastly underappeciated.

pros: Such a fun place to work and the love that you have for the awesome kids that you take on is unbelievable.  Some many skilled are can be taken away from this place.  The most fulfilling job I had every had.
cons: You have to create initiative for yourself to get noticed and for anything to happen.  There is a big difference between the part-time staff and full-time staff which it is very difficult to become full-time.  Upper management do not understand exactly what is happening on the floor, so it very hard for them to assist. Employees are always burnt out due to the crazy staff to child ratio.

pros: The kids really look up to you as a mentor.  No day is the same, as kids come in with different needs and moods each time you clock in.  The activities and games that you plan and play are always active and engaging.  The work is never boring, and you learn what it's like to be a kid all again!
cons: The pay is not great, and sometimes it can be difficult to get enough hours.  With any job involving kids, some days can seem wildly disorganized.

review_title: Wonderful way to help kids, and work with great people!
pros: You get to do a job where you really feel you are helping youth and the community. You get to see progress being made, and the type of employees attracted to this type of work are great, so you get to work with the best people. There is plenty of creativity allowed.
cons: You don't do this job to become rich. The compensation takes into consideration that this is a nonprofit. You may have days with more stress than others.

review_title: This job is TOUGH, but at least the pay sucks.
pros: Working with kids, making a difference in their lives. Some days, you'll find yourself thinking, " I can't believe I get paid (horribly) to do this?!" After a few months of being taken advantage of.... more often you'll fin yourself thinking, "I don't get paid enough to do this!"
cons: The BGCB works you to the bone as much as you'll allow. But at least the pay is awful. As with most non-profits - they work the staff until the collapse because we all have big hearts - while the higher ups get paid the big bucks and have no idea how hard the jobs are.

pros:
If you're lucky, part of a good team 
Gain experience as program leader with students and children. 
Good place to figure out behavior intervention techniques that work for you 
Sometimes rewarding
cons:
Low pay 
No ladder climbing if hired as part time 
Condescending management 
Low support from main site 
Low support from school site and administrators and teachers

pros: Great mission.  Dedicated staff who have committed their livelihoods to the organization's work. Extremely passionate and committed board.
cons: Senior leadership.  A youth-based organization focused on kids and family and some of the leadership don't carry those same values into their own lives.  Hard to believe this would be who is best to lead this organization.

job_title: Youth Development Professional in Tyler, TX
pros:
The kids I worked with were so diverse and, for the most part, eager to learn and have fun!
My direct (on-site) superior was organized and a pleasure to work with!
cons:
Poor Pay: I was paid minimum wage even though I had a Teaching Certification and prior experience working with kids. I heard from co-workers that there may be a chance of a raise after a semester or a year. This job barely works as supplemental income!

Unprofessional Co-workers: Some team members were frequently late and absent without notice, with no disciplinary action being taken against them!

Lack of Recognition/Reward/Incentives: Our faults were emphasized with little to no recognition for outstanding attendance and performance.

review_title: If you don't take yourself seriously how will anyone else?
job_title: Integrated Marketing Communications Director in Imperial Beach, CA
pros: The mission & vision of the organization are amazing and the idea of helping great futures start here is great.  The BGCA core values are ones that everyone should live by everyday and being around smiling faces that you indirectly and directly impact is very rewarding.
cons: The leadership needs work.  There is an "unspoken" issue with favoritism and cliques that everybody complains about but nobody has the courage to change it.  There is very little opportunity for growth in the organization unless you have the right friends in your corner.  The organization is filled with emotionally immature employees that would rather sit and gossip than to work.

job_title: Ofice Coordinator in North Decatur, GA
pros: If you like working with kids it's very fulfilling
cons: Short amount of time with a alot of work expectations.  Administrative duties as well as children continuously coming in and out of the center that you have to stop working to check in and out.  Your constantly being called away from your desk but your still responsible for who walks in and out of the center. You! and there is not a security person only you.

review_title: This national organization offers tremendous growth opportunity and a decent paycheck.
pros: * Wonderful * people - dedicated, caring. I must give them their due.  In this era of ageism, I've noticed that the organization values seasoned/veteran employees. If you can get your foot in the door, and you are fortunate to have decent management, you could retire from the organization if you can hang on. I salute the senior management for the generally excellent benefits and their commitment to excellence.
cons: Very limited advancement, unless you relocate to Atlanta HQ or transition to a local Club. Even allowing for the constraints of non-profit salary scales, pay *could* be better, as well as the workload distribution...Certain  departments are perceived more favorably than others...creates subtle elitism.

pros: The children are worth the hardships.  There is not a lot of money within the organization but pay is still pretty good for the amount of hours.  You do work for your money but if you enjoy working with children it won't feel like work.
cons: Administrating staff was not the best.  They are gone now which allows those that really want to work with children to have an opportunity to do so. Hated that the two top administrators were the ones always complaining; it trickles down the umbrella of staff and to the children as well.

job_title: Former National Director of Native Services in Richardson, TX
pros: Enjoyed my work while part of the Boys & Girls Club Movement. A mission that truly helps youth across the country to be the best they can.
cons: The amount of time to build a great program dies take away from personal time with family, if you're considering a career with BGCA make sure you find balance.

review_title: To have my kids be part of such amazing place was good. I took care of all teens and kids checking in.
job_title: Front Desk Associate in East Palo Alto, CA
pros: Its all a great feeling to work with colleagues who are all full of energy and always with a positive attitude. The management has been the most amazing bosses I've ever had.
cons: A few of the challenges that I encountered were when, I had to wait for a parent who was getting their to the facility late to pick up a child after hours.

review_title: It has been somewhat a bittersweet experience
pros: One reason I enjoyed working their was I was given a great amount of autonomy to develop my programs for the members of our club.
cons: In the beginning, I thought that I had found the perfect employment. I was working with children as an educator, I was working with technology that I loved, and I had great autonomy in developing program activities for our members. However, as time progressed, we did not keep pace with technology. Additionally, over the years, our staff was cut as well as the budget for our club. Also, management was innefective in our club.

review_title: Great stepping stone to future careers in education
job_title: After School Program Staff in Bakersfield, CA
pros: Working with the kids, lots of training held throughout the year, teacher liason helped me find new and creative ways to reach the students, and the teacher liason also helped me perfect my classroom management techniques,  the crew I worked with were great
cons: starting pay could be better, but it is non-profit.

pros: Lots of fun! Pretty relaxed supervisors, chill environment, GREAT coworkers. They also give you good structure and training when first starting, and my supervisors were always very helpful and responsive.
cons: Some upper management expecting too much/not being able to understand what it's like to actually work in the field with the kids. Maybe they forgot, but asking for unrealistic things/assuming you're not busy running your own programs and can totally do this random time consuming errand/passing restrictive dress codes, etc.

review_title: Help kids and the community, but don't say yes to every hat!
pros: I appreciate the BGC of A structure which allows communities to put their own flavor on clubs. I liked a lot of the curriculums. I had some great, valuable, successful and fun moments with kids.
cons: You are asked to wear far too many hats. It becomes unbearable if you don't learn how to set boundaries, and some people do not respect those boundaries.

pros: The reward of seeing a member come back who is successful.. Amazing! Working for the Clubs allows you the opportunity to customize your own position. You can truly put your ideas out there. Love the flexibility
cons: The Clubs are more geared toward quantity of the buildings, versus the quality of programming. I don't feel or see the dedication to its employees. In all the time I've been there, I am not full of the passion that I used to. Unsure of the company's direction anymore!

review_title: If Boys & Girls Club-Philadelphia offers you a job, run!
pros: You get to make a difference with youth. Developing relationships with the kids will keep you coming to work because you know you are making a difference.
cons: The pay is horrific. The CEOs expect ppl with degrees to work for close to minimum wage with no raises. There are people that have worked at the club for 10 years with no appreciation and no raise. There are NEVER any supplies, not even pencils for the kids. The CEOs and EPOs only care about themselves and not the kids and staff. They also take the money that you fundraise and use because they are in debt.

review_title: A good job for the right person only
pros:
Making a difference in the lives of children and teens
Working with like-minded people
Generous time off
Reasonable insurance benefits
Diverse staff
Opportunities for professional development
Full-time employment opportunities
Decent pay for a non-profit organization
cons:
Working evenings and weekends
Poor work-life balance
Difficult to take time off
Very different expectations, resources, supervisors, and culture at each club
High turnover 
Transporting children
Long hours
Low pay in comparison to all other sectors (no surprises there, though)

job_title: After School Teacher in Long Beach, CA
pros: you get experience with kids if you choose to be a teacher in the future. it is also a fun work environment because of the activities you get to do with the kids
cons: they ask more from the program leaders than they should they must create lesson plans a month in advance. there is not enough prep time in order to complete the lesson plans and get your supplies ready for the day almost impossible. finally there are no raises to give to the program leaders (after school teachers). you could be working there for 8 years and you wont see a raise.

review_title: Rewarding, and great practice for future teachers!
job_title: Youth Program Coordinator in Fort Atkinson, WI
pros: This is a great place to work if you are looking to have a career in working with children. You get to experience managing a large group of kids and having alot of fun while doing it! This is a great place to work if you genuinely enjoy kids, if you don't definitely not the place for you!
cons: The only downside for me was the pay. Being that it is a non-profit I expected the pay to be low, but it makes it hard to pay the bills!

pros:
*working with youth on a meaningful level
*good lower level management in some cases
*a creative working atmosphere at times
cons:
*lack of focus on core mission at upper levels of management
*poor employee retention
*lack of employee support in getting innovative ideas accomplished from higher levels
*poor leadership practices
*low pay
*excessive spending at higher management levels on luxuries
*lack of focus on diversity
*male dominated atmosphere and practices

review_title: Disappointing---experienced buyers "remorse" within 3 weeks of hire.
pros: BGCA's mission is undeniable, positively affecting the lives of children is wonderful. Club kids are a joy as are those that work in the clubs.
cons: As others have stated, business processes and technology are years behind, even for a non-profit. Extremely high turnover in certain departments, yet those leaders are still rewarded heartily. Tiered treatment of employees as if they are hiring unskilled laborers vs professionals. No bonuses or good PTO plans for those doing the heavy lifting.

review_title: Doing great things under trying circumstances
pros:
-great for those trying to get into the youth development field.
-can have the opportunity to positively impact the lives of youth who need it.
cons:
-toxic work culture that emphasizes over-work with little compensation or support. 
-lack of clear goals or strategic plans.
- willingness to fudge data to make it appear as if the organization is doing more. 
-high adult:child ratio which leads to several behavioral issues.
-minimal opportunities for advancement or professional development.
-upper management with little concern for how things work on the ground. 
-both staff and programs are underfunded. Staff are expected to do a lot with little time, resources or back up support.
-clique-y, manipulative management.
-"jack of all trades, master of none."
-burn-out factory.

pros: The staff are genuinely kind people who are amazingly passionate about serving kids!  The mission of the organization is powerful.  I've witnessed countless transformations in the lives/character of the youth given the access to resources and caring staff.
cons: As a big non-profit, there is often disconnect between the leadership (major decision makers) and the direct service staff who engage with kids daily.  Communication across and within the organization is a challenge and if often fragmented or simply lacking.

review_title: Depends what school you work with.
job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Riverside, CA
pros: It is a great experience working with the kids. Its a very rewarding job.
cons:
You have to be on your feet for hours at a time. I had a manager actually tell me I could not sit down at any point on my shift as Staff with the children.. Which made it difficult to connect with the kids. 

Many of the Site Coordinators have favorites, and will make you do the "dirty work" of the job. I even had a manager make a mess and make me clean it up.

review_title: Good for the soul, bad for the pocket
job_title: Do Not Wish to Reveal in Washington, DC
pros:
You get to be a positive influence on kids.
You stay young at heart.  Good training for parents and parents to be.
There is no dollar value to match a child's appreciation of how you have helped him/her.
Main organization in Atlanta is fundamentally sound and programs are in place.
cons:
Low, non-commensurate pay.
Slim chances of promotion.  Old-timers rule and discriminate.
Poor leadership and upper management.  Incompetents tolerated.
Short-sighted vision. Management culling and padding numbers only for show to board and funders.  Organization does not recognize quality of long term work by club staff with kids.  
Fast turn-over of staff due to low pay, and worse, intrigues.
Poor accountability with finances.

review_title: I commend the organization for its work with kids.
pros: The organization's mission to help disadvantage kids and the programs that many of the clubs do for the children in communities across the country is tremendous.
cons: Many of the clubs in smaller areas of the country don't get to take advantage of the programs and funding because of a lack of communication and willingness to work with smaller clubs. Management in many areas lacks quality management skills and treats newer employees poorly. The turnover rate there is very high and the HR department is not one that advocates for employees so assistance with workplace issues are almost impossible to resolve. The resolution is termination when there is a complaint made.

job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Paterson, NJ
pros: The biggest pro about this job is the children. Knowing you’re going to work and helping children who admire you is a wonderful feeling. You’ll have a few apples that are rotten, but it won’t be anything you can’t handle.
cons: Too much drama with the staff. It’s frustrating to do your job to the best of your abilities when the staff don’t get along. Everyone has their “cliques” and rumors spread so quickly. It felt like people were on different teams. Don’t work here if you hate drama.

pros:
Valuable services to needy communities
Some staff are unbelievably committed and dedicated
Kids need the help desperately
A few great people work there
cons:
Favoritism and unfairness in assessing staff - inconsistent rewarding of favorites 
Part time employees can work there for many years and never receive benefits or full time jobs
No career ladder as top management waits to retire
Fee based revenue charges poor families - no real commitment to the poor
Silo mentality - no real sharing of information
Top down management practices don't take staff into consideration

pros: good pay. sufficient work hours.
cons: Friend ship over profesionalism. inadaquite staff.  disrespectful work enviorment/employees.  lack of equality in employees. seasonal.

pros: It's wonderful to work with children and teenagers. I enjoyed being a mentor and I learned a lot about systematic injustice, the insufficiency of public education, and the issues youth face today. I benefitted a lot of members and learned a lot in the process.
cons: Low pay, and lower pay for women. A lot of emphasis on children ages 5-12 even though there is a great need for programs for teenagers. Employees (especially unit directors) who work with teenagers or in Hispanic/Latino outreach are paid less than their preteen unit counterparts. Higher ups abuse the directors and the YDPLs because they know that most people won't leave since they love the children so much.

pros: Benefits are excellent - free healthcare, 401k match, short and long term disability, etc. Compensation based on performance is generous if you go the extra mile. People in general are very nice and focused on the mission. The loyalty to the organization and mission is amazing. You feel good about what we're all wanting to accomplish.
cons: Department restructuring is too often. Leadership tends to demand requests often very last minute leading to stress and chaos throughout the organization. There is a lag in terms of resources and technology considering there is money to fund big projects and make improvements. Disconnect between regional offices and headquarters can lead to friction.

pros: Incredible mission and pockets of deeply passionate people who are experts at what they do.
cons: Headcount consolidated so deeply that it’s impossible to be effective. Very little trust in senior or upper-level leaders. In-fighting between departments at the senior level. Employees openly calling for the resignation of senior leaders. Open disdain for others. Total disconnect from the spirit of the mission to the environment at the headquarters. All fun left the building and with it, the heart of the work.

review_title: Boys and Girls Club of Redlands, CA
job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Campbell, CA
pros: I thought the management staff I was with was great. They were supportive of me working as a student and were flexible with my hours.
cons: The downside that I ran into while working at the Boys and Girls Club was that because it was such a big program, a lot of the little details would get lost. This included the planning of activities and having the appropriate supplies or demonstration for the students.

review_title: Great if you work for National Level /Horrible if You Work with a Poorly Managed Local Level
pros: The National Team is great and I can honestly not say anything about them! They really do love kids!
cons: The local level that I was at as a Marketing Director was very poorly run, unqualified people are put into a position of authority and cause havoc and an unprofessional work environment when the CEO and CFO aren't paying attention. They're poor planning also leads to budget cuts not only in terms of positions and staff but in program funding for the kids as well which is the real downside. My direct supervisor constantly used profanity in the workplace, and made the environment very hostile for everyone who worked under her.

review_title: Assistant School Site Director/ Summer YDS
pros:
Very rewarding
Love working with the kids
Set hours
the relationships and trust I have built with the kids always makes me feel accomplished and great at the end of the day
cons:
Can be understaffed at times causing stress
A Select few children and parents can be hard to handle.
Pay rate for part time work compared to other child care companies

pros:
Good people who make up the teams
They subsidize Marta pass or parking, whichever you choose
Employee health insurance monthly coverage is paid 100%
cons:
Poor internal communication
Too many meetings; not enough action after--all talk, but nothing to show for it
Seemingly run very corporate, but so many internal reports that it's hard to get things done
I discovered first-hand after leaving that not all programs are being run at the local level Clubs like HQ thinks they might be. Very disappointing!

review_title: Boys and Girls Club of Wayne County
pros: The programs are great, working with youth is a wonderful experience, there is sometimes room for advancement
cons: Wayne County is too much of a clique and plays a hidden agenda, lack of communication with employees, last minute planning of events, and the pay is pathetic. For all the training the club puts their employees though, you would think their employees would be worth more than minimum wage. Even with a degree, the hearts and souls of every club who keep them operating day in and day out, make next to nothing.

pros: The Boys and Girls club is an incredible experience, if your feeling down or depressed, go and volunteer there.  Not only will you feel better about yourself, you'll have a great time teaching and helping the kids and staff.  Its one of the most rewarding things I've ever done, and it looks great on a resume.  Hey you might even learn a thing or two.
cons: The inner city boys and girls clubs are not for the faint of heart.  You may need some thick skin and a loud voice.  Also if your volunteering you obviously wont be getting paid.

review_title: Perhaps what one would expect from non-profit childcare
job_title: Child Development Professional in Anchorage, AK
pros: Kids are pretty good depending on where you work.  I normally worked at a very diverse before-and-after-school program so I usually loved it.
cons:
There were some other programs at some very privileged schools where the kids were much more spoiled and less fun to work with.
The employees at the main clubhouse could be really catty and gossipy to the point of getting people fired.  Definitely did my best to stay at the off-site programs

pros: Great experience if you stay long enough to put it on your resume. Opportunity to do a lot of extra projects to show your worth. Employee yearly holiday party with cool prizes. Excellent benefits package for full-time employees.
cons: Very driven on progressive discipline. Staff are encouraged to point the finger at the person who made the mistake so they don't get in trouble. Unorganized management team who don't get along. Toxic, high pressure work environment. Stressful deadlines and expectations. Inconsistent pay across employees. Management considers any positions outside Administration as replaceable. Regular staff don't get to give input on company culture or growth.

review_title: Interesting place to work.... Kids plus community make for interesting work environment
pros: The kids that attend are quite entertaining and fellow staff care about child welfare as a top priority. A good place to to experience lots of different cultures in a safe controlled environment. Management that works in office is able to relate to staff better than out of office management.
cons: Working with a wide age gap between some levels of management and employees can cause some clashing. Also some of the children that attend are not ready or able to attend care outside of parental care. Alarming number of kid to staff ratio can be kind of hectic at times.

pros: You learn something new every day. The administrative staff and the CEO of the organization work really hard to make sure you get the training you need to be effective in your position. They also promote from within. If you have the skills and talent and wish to grow with the organization then you are given the opportunity to do so.
cons: One challenge would be the pay/salary. Since it is a non profit organization, they rely on donors to give funding.

pros:
The kids actually learned their math skills, reading, and writing etc.  
Gets "your front in the door" for other daycare and learning center jobs.
Reliability when it comes to getting paid on time.
cons:
Gossiping staff, hardly doing any work.
Low pay.
Got let go because one of my co-workers didn't like me and ran and told my boss I wasn't a good fit for the company. (It had nothing to do with my great work ethic or positive attitude. I was the only one actually doing my job anyway. Sad case.) They didn't enjoy my professional and calm manner. They wanted someone who was loud and gossiped with them.

review_title: Great Benefits, good staff members but direction of management and overall advancement potential poor.
pros: Great Benefits there. The rank and file work hard to make a difference.
cons:
Very poor advancement opportunities. Too many "like mindedness" prevalent in organization. Thinking outside of the box not encouraged.  Very high ideals but no real traction when it comes to making a "real" difference in the lives of the youth they serve.  Organization undergoing some monumental personnel shifts - key staffers are leaving weekly and are being replaced with lower-paid, lower qualified hires that are further eroding the talent base of the organization and upward, progressive growth.  

When the new President took over there were high expectations that there would be substantive changes made to upper-level management responsible for the decline in progressive thought and innovative direction.  With no real change in the major dynamic stifling growth, many of the "best and brightest" had enough and started to leave. Overall not the best place for someone seeking a long-term career move. Until a "sea change" is made, this organization will continue to rake in donor's money and spend it on lavish travel and salaries for those at the top and neglect the kids who need those dollars and resources the most.

pros: The days are short over the school year and well worth the pay.  The days go by really fast because you are always doing something or running some activity.
cons: You will be working with kids and therefore the days will never go as expected.  Whatever you think can go wrong will go wrong.  On the bright side there is never a dull moment.

pros: The BGC remains a transparent & trustworthy organization in each community you find it. The values & vision of local clubhouses truly reiterate the impact you are making in the lives of children and their families. You'll always have the intrinsic motivation to show up to work on time!
cons: A lot of practical tasks need to be done in the evening and weekends when interacting with BGC community members. The hours are not conducive to a 9-5 office schedule.

pros: They focus on making great opportunities for youth in underserved communities. It is the top priority from the floor staff to the club director. The National model is definitely something I still greatly admire and I would work for another Boys and Girls Club again.
cons: I found little room for advancement in this group. In my experience the upper management was always in a chaotic state of reorganization. I saw four different CEO's in the six years I worked there and there was an ongoing need to explain why I was there and what my role was. High staff turnover rate.

pros: There are really cool people who work there. It is a pretty laid back work place and there is not a lot of hard work to do.
cons: The kids are the biggest challenge. If you don't have thick skin or get your feelings hurt easily, I would suggest maybe working with the younger kids because the teens will tear you apart.

pros: Sometimes we were able to come up with fun activities with the kids with no materials, but it was often difficult to do.
cons: Rarely given arts and craft supplies, gym supplies, etc, but still expected to provide the same quality of care and activities for children without them. Parents often blamed us for disciplinary problems with children.

job_title: Director of Operations in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great place to build your skills with working with youth. Awesome experience In mentoring youth from all walks of life whether it's inner city, rural areas, to low income poverty areas.
cons: Limited room for growth. I sort of feel it is not what you know it is who you know in this movement to move up in the ranks,

pros: Job duties were clearly lined out when interviewing, kids were a blast to work with and daily scheduling was well organized.
cons: The hours were strict and conflicted with my class schedule which was the reason for why I left. Some parents were argumentative, but no incidents led me to consider quitting for that reason.

job_title: Arts Program Coordinator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: I loved that I was able to create the curriculum. It was wonderful to incorporate literary arts into the the visual arts programming. The staff was also lovely and very committed.
cons: Since I was part of the after school program I could not use the materials from the art classroom since it was separate from the school. This was a little challenging and stressful as I had to walk down a hallway each day with supplies on a cart and return them. Supplies overall were limited and the pay for this position was far too low for the work I was doing.

review_title: It was a very fun and exciting experience
pros: I thought that the work hours and the way they treated their team leaders were excellent. I had a great time working their and the atmosphere was very fun and embracing.
cons: I didnt like my boss that much. He was a great person but i dont think he really knew how to manage people and lead people.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Menlo Park, CA
pros: I love the organization's focus on serving kids in under-served communities. We truly meet the kids where they are, and work to help them to close the achievement gap. The staff members are passionate about their work, and truly committed to our mission. I feel supported in my job, and like I'm part of a great team.
cons: Like any non-profit, I think people tend to work too hard and stay too late. It's mostly because they are inspired to serve our kids, but I'd love to see people try and manage work-life balance better.

review_title: Passionate people in a fun-loving atmosphere
pros: The community is fantastic, as the organization truly cares for their employees and wants to see everyone succeed. The relationships between the families served and the employees is highly rewarding and people are often grateful for the services provided. People who genuinely care about what they do and who they work with and for. Great professional development. Matching 401-k program.
cons: The health insurance, while provided, was bare bones and employee retention wasn't always very high (possibly due to salary) so employees often had to pick up slack in other areas which could lead to struggle with work-life balance.

review_title: Working at the Boys and Girls Club is inspiring and rewarding.
pros: The staff at the Boys and Girls Club are wonderful because everyone there is there for a cause and for a passion, rather than for the money. Everyone is very down-to-earth.
cons: You are not paid for any additional time you put in besides your strict hours. As a result, it's hard to lesson plan during the hours given, since children are there during all of those hours. You only get one hour of paid, child-free lesson planning per week.

job_title: Program Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: To work with the youth in community was a blessing because I was once a member and was able to give back to my community. The staff are great and it is a very pleasant place to work.
cons: The working hours are different depending on which BGCSTL location you are at and your program area. Also the organization works around SLPS school schedule so if the kids do not have school you typically do not work unless otherwise noted.

pros: Kids are great to work with, loved the job and working with the children when I saw them.
cons: The HR and Management Team need to be replaced, they are Bullies and Intimidators, They hire only to pick on, discriminate, bully and have their way, The directors the same. They will lie about you and make stuff up that you did not do. They will not think twice to throw you under the bus if it mean saving their butts. Just watch out, no one is safe the harassment alone will get to you and then eventually they will mentally and verbally abuse you as well.

job_title: Site Facilitator in San Antonio, TX
pros: The organization has a great mission and it provides an opportunity to really make a difference in young lives.
cons: The pay is barely a livable wage and I had to find 2 additional side jobs to get by. For all the work they expect and all the energy I put into this position, the compensation is pretty pathetic. There is high turnover, probably because people can't afford to work here for long. The HR department is awful and never responds to e-mails so the hiring process was a joke.

pros: It was great to be able to work with kids and help them have fun. They were always full of energy, and honestly they were entertaining.
cons: Not enough pay. Too much micro management going on and not enough focus on the kids. One kid got mad at a coworker of mine and told her mom that he touched her. He ended up losing everything, and even though there was 0 evidence he actually went in front of a judge. It was dismissed, but because of that I would never work in this environment again.

review_title: Problems start at the top and trickle all the way down
pros: Working with kids is great! There's a lot of flexibility with the programming and every day is different. At the individual club level you can learn a lot of different marketable skills like: teaching art, teaching healthy lifestyles, management, grant writing, and fundraising.
cons: The Executive Director only cares about quantity not quality. The organization is adding more clubs every year when they can't adequately take care of the ones they have. They don't care about the well being of the kids or quality of their UD's as long as they are making their numbers.  They don't trust or value their employees.

review_title: Political enviroment that forgets it's great mission
pros:
The kids and families you will meet are joyful
21st Century programs seem to have good programs, staff and leadership 
Several wonderful  volunteers care about giving back to the kids
cons:
This organization is focused on increasing the number of youth served without growing the infrastructure.  The staff/site that report the most youth served was glorified, even through it was not audited they were serving the nubmer of youth they said they were or that they followed the organizations standards for serving youth.  
Bad employee behavior and unmet deadlines are common.
Very reactive culture, if you like to have clear cut goals and like to use numbers and data/feedback to know you are having an impact on the youth you serve, this is not the place for you.

review_title: A bizarre combination of wonderful and terrible.
pros:
The best reason to work here is when you arrive at work, there are many smiling faces happy to see you. Working with children is such an incredible experience. It feels like a blessing to know so many unique personalities. 

It's a great starting point for a career working with children. If you're in college seeking part-time work, this would be a satisfactory place to work.
cons:
It's part-time. Each club has only four full-time employees. I felt like I was being taken advantage of because if I wanted more hours, I had to be willing to stay late or work weekends but my weekly hours could never go over 29.5.

As an activity leader, you're forced to do an immense amount of work in a short period of time. I was often stuck with 30+ kids and no additional staff members to help me. This made it extremely difficult to implement an activity or a game if there was an injury or if a child was having behavior issues. In those situations, you either have to stick your head out the door and yell for help or hope that another staff member wanders through your room.

At my particular club, we never had supplies. Often I would have to buy anything I needed to be successful at the club and I was never reimbursed. It's damn near impossible to be an art teacher when all you have are dried out markers, donated fabric swatches and a bunch of other useless crap. My mom donated 30 small boxes of crayons, but many of them were jacked by my co-workers, who were suffering as well. Sometimes we didn't even have enough chairs. 

Discipline is a joke. Write-ups, parent conferences, and 1 or 2 day suspensions were all that would happen. I've never seen someone kicked out of the club and I've had a chair thrown at me.

review_title: I enjoyed working here. it was really fun and i liked kids so it was nice and they make you feel comfortable.
job_title: Boys & Girls Club in San Francisco, CA
pros: They are really nice and supportive . they give jobs to youth in the community there are very understanding they are nice .
cons: The hours can be hard and i mean theres not really alot of bad things to say theres not a lot bad things i think that it is a good thing overall

pros: I enjoyed working with the kids and most of my co-workers.  I also liked the fact that I was able to make a difference in kids' lives.
cons: The boss that I had at the time didn't treat me fairly.  That being said, I think that the Boys & Girls Club is an honorable cause, and their reputation shouldn't be ruined by a few bad apples.

review_title: Great Place Does Amazing things- But staff need more compensation
pros: Relationships with the youth and staff. Truly kind and caring individuals.
cons: The amount of responsibilities placed on employees with little compensation training, or guidance in return. As a result there is too much turn over and youth desperately need consistency.

pros: Flexibility, certain teams are good, excellent mission
cons: Too political, ego driven leadership. Constant change shows lack of true strategic plan. This is not a good time to join this organization. You do so at your own possible peril depending on the department you’re joining. If coming from corporate, don’t. They won’t respect your experience and may shut you down from enacting things that could truly improve processes, procedures and overall success.

review_title: Great Place, Change is very often, lots of perks
job_title: Business Operations Support Specialist in Atlanta, GA
pros:
Great caring team of people. Good insurance/benefits mostly paid by BGCA. Kaiser .
Always something to learn, to eat to do.
Celebrity visits are awesome!
cons: Constant change in directions, work load, teams throughout. This is one thing to plan on. If you can have a positive outlook, you will make it.

pros: It was a great learning opportunity and I worked with many wonderful opportunity.
cons: The organization is very backwards in many ways; it is disorganized and mismanaged. The people making the decisions are never the ones who are present in the classrooms and familiar with the needs of the schools that they service.

job_title: I Am A Working Man and I Wont Give Up Until I Accomplish My Goals in Fort Pierce, FL
pros: Making friends, staying on task,  Getting my work done, Doing what's right, My skills, talking to others, positive attitude
cons: i haven't met my match because I love to work so I don't really know

pros: I considered my mission field, being able to make a difference in some childs day was very rewarding. Not only providing nourishing food to the children,which the meal that they received at the club may be the only one of the day that for them, is sad. I also had a opportunity to meet them on a one on one basis share there days experiences, I was also able to conduct a cooking class with some of the Boys And Girls which was fun.
cons: There really aren't any exceptnmaybe the kitchen equipment and cooking tools need some upgrading.

job_title: Youth Development Professional in Knoxville, TN
pros:
The kids
The staff I work with personally
cons: Everything else including upper management, administration, policy makers, pay ($8/hr), hours allowed to work per week (no more than 25), no benefits at all, not even paid holidays, no sick time accrual, worthless training put on by upper management without travel allowances or reimbursement, last minute changes to plans made by upper management, compartmentalization of everything, non-team players in upper management, CEO makes over $100,000/year while the real workers make just above minimum wage and have no benefits at all, and yet we are expected to make out weekly lesson plans and monthly reports like we are teachers.

review_title: Boys and Girls Club of the Tennessee Valley
pros:
The idea of being able to help students and communities in need. 
Some managers and staff were there for the students and the community.
cons:
I was limited in what I could do because there were so many conflicting grant-required programs. 
I was working in a housing project and there were gun-shots and we didn't have a lock-down plan, and the director wasn't concerned. 
I wasn't given a desk or computer to do my job. I came to find out this was a power play. I truly just wanted to help support students and the community, but was prevented from doing so.

review_title: Great place to work! Flexible and supporting staff!
pros: I worked at BGC during the summer and for a year in college. Some pros of the company include; flexible times (there are subs as long as you contact ahead of time), if no sub could be found our site manager would still make things work, the staff truly cared about the kids they worked with, the staff was like a family, there was great cooperation between the school and the club (we could get a students teacher from their room if needed for behavior reasons), the staff was asked to come up with themes and activities to engage the kids each week (this engaged not only the kids, but kept us workers excited about what we did with the kids)!
cons: We were short handed often, so combining large groups of different ages often made it difficult to engage all kids in the activity. While my experience was good, I know that that is entirely because I had an amazing site coordinator who had our backs and did all he could to help and support us! I know that not all sites have this kind of coordinator, and advise you to look into your local management first. Talk to the program leaders that already work under that person!

review_title: Why I did not get hired in the Boys and Girls Club in Delaware?
pros: The Boys and Girls Club is a great place for children.
cons: What does it takes for someone to get a position at the United Boys and Girls Club in the state of Delaware.  However the organization is good for the safety and care of children.

pros: Great opportunities to advance with hard work, great opportunity to impact the lives of young people, and usually great staff to work with. My organization also offered top notch healthcare for a great price and 401k matching.
cons: The pay is terrible! When compared to equivalent positions in private youth development organizations, Boys & Girls Clubs just do not stack up in pay. Because people don't donate like they used to, the reports that are required are over the top to get funding from outside agencies.

pros:
Fun, Casual workplace
Working with wide range of kids (6-17)
Dedicated co-workers
Decent health insurance
cons:
PT to FT pipeline is not for everyone
Second shift hours, unpaid overtime
Duties include cleaning bathrooms, dishes and bodily fluids
Crazy child to adult ratios (up to 45 to 1!)
Skimpy paycheck, even for a nonprofit
High turn-over for part-time and full-time employees
Stressful home situations can follow kids to the club
I was reimbursed for expenses I paid for club supplies once in 2 years.

review_title: Best Place to Work! (Except for Upper Management!) (Sheboygan County Unit)
pros:
Ability to build relationships with children in the community by providing them with a fun, safe, and caring facility. You have the power to be a role model for the youth through structured and educational programs that help kids/teens in their everyday life. The programs provided by Club staff have measurable impact on the youth that participate and attend regularity. The innovative programs designed to empower youth to excel in school, become good citizens and lead healthy, productive lives. (Sports and Recreation, Education, The Arts, Health and Wellness, Career Development, Character and Leadership.) 

You have a great deal of influence on the kids/teens that enter the doors. It is an amazing experience to be a part of. I miss it every day since I discontinued working at the Boys & Girls Club.

Training and Networking opportunities are abundant as well as community and volunteer involvement.

The upper management was fairly organized with administrative tasks, however, lacked in other areas.
cons:
The turn over rate for a Unit Directors at Sheboygan County BGC is VERY high, and that is due to the upper management team. Many hard working and passionate Unit Directors have sadly left their positions working at this location due to the stressful and negative environment that is unnecessarily created. The kids/teens grow to be attached to the Unit Directors and it is a shame that the turn over rate is so high. Most people who apply to work at BGC do so because they are passionate and motivated to help youth, especially those who need it most. I was enticed to be a part of this organization because it enriched my soul, not my bank account. 

There was always a great deal of judgement, negativity, and inappropriate criticism that came from upper management. Sometimes it was directed at Unit Directors or Program Staff, other times is was in reference to the members, and members families that were a part of the BGC. My respect was lost with upper management when one of them told me to "try and get rid of a naughty child asap!". This comment was made during the BGC's "first come, first serve" sign up. 

With that in mind, here is the Boys & Girls Club's Mission Statement: 
"To enable all young people, especially those who need us most, to reach their full potential as productive, caring, responsible citizens." 

How can a child be helped if they aren't given a chance?

review_title: Personally Rewarding, but No Feedback from Management
pros: Working at the Boys and Girls Club was very rewarding personally. Each day I was able to directly see the difference I was making in these young people's lives. If you are interested in a job that makes a difference in a child's life- this is for you. I also was able to hand pick the students I wished to tutor based on their grades, which was wonderful. I was also able to make my own schedule and choose the tutoring materials. They also allowed me to request purchases for certain materials. Overall the two pluses about this job- helping children towards a more successful life and the self-managing aspect.
cons: The main complaint I have with this job was the lack of feedback. When I was given the position I did realize that it was a very broad-based job, and that I was able to organize the system however I wished, under very few guidelines, which I enjoyed. But, the lack of feedback was discouraging at times. My superior had vaguely mentioned to me about writing a report each quarter- although no one had ever done so in this position, therefore there were no guidelines for this. Now, I have no problem with creating my own format- but some feedback would have been nice. I simply adapted my own report system- and turned it in- it was always accepted and I was told it was "good", but that was it. In fact, when I left this job I felt very confused on their opinion of me. I had never been reprimanded or asked to change something I had done, but I had also never been told that I was doing a great job. So, when they approached me this previous year- asking for me to come back and ranting on how well I did- I was pleasantly but VERY surprised- because I had no clue how they felt about my work performance.

review_title: Its a good teen, young twenty job
pros: they work around your schedule.  You get most days off the school gets.  they have meetings where you get free pizza, deserts, soda, bottled water,  and praised
cons: some kids will talk major trash to you, some will directly challenge you, some will hit you.  no real pay raises

review_title: Great experience, management invests in employees.
pros: A small organization, with only two sites, BGCH is a tremendous organization to work for.  The current management staff really cares about the staff as much as pursuing the organization's mission. It can be tough to secure a job here because the staff who do typically stay for a while.
cons: Because of the organization's size, it can take a while to move up.  While utilizing PTO is encouraged, it can be hard if more than one person wants the same time.  Pay can stagnate.

review_title: Great kids and co-workers, less great management and procedures
pros: I absoltuley love the kids I work with and the fact that I am contributing to positive changes in my own community. Many of my co-workers and I are so passionate about what we do and truely want what's best for the kids and to see positive change within our community. This is a place I plan to volunteer at once I move on to my permanent career.
cons: Budget makes it hard to retain passionate staff who really know what they are doing and how to better the club. Hours are cut at random and staff are viewed as replacable to management, making it an unreliable job to count on for a steady paycheck. They'll let an amazing staff member walk out the door to hire a so-so less educated person who will do the job for less. More is always expected from employees for less, if you're salaried you generally put in 80 hour weeks, if you're part-time paid 20 hours a week you may have to "volunteer" to work an additinal 20 hours at your cost  to get your job done to management standards.

review_title: Great Kids but Management Plays Favorites
pros:
The Kids really should be the main reason to work for the organization. If you are a compassionate and truly caring person, who genuinely cares about making an impact on a kids life, then you may enjoy this job. If you don't have the patience to deal with over a hundred excited kids looking up to you as a mentor, then you should not even apply.
-The organization provides many training opportunities.
-Its a fun and active atmosphere if you are working in one of the clubs.
-There are decent benefits for full-time employees
cons:
-The absolute worst part of working for BGCMP is that there is a network of people in leadership and management positions who know each other in other capacities. Whether they are church friends, former co-workers at other jobs, or just buddies, there is quite a bit of nepotism going on in  the hiring process. 
-Also, the kids are not always put first when it comes to staffing choices, promotional choices, and programming. Preserving an image seems to be put first in a lot of cases. 
- As a part-timer, it seems you can almost get away with murder. However, the second you are a full-time employee, you can be offed and fired just for rubbing someone the wrong way. 
- Organizational changes in management often mean that people are coming in to "clean house" and give zero regard to the relationships staff have built with the members, their families and the community.
-Admin staff members often seem to talk down to club staff members. There seems to be a disconnect and information often gets passed down the chain of command in a way that can make you feel out of the loop until it is too late.

review_title: A supervisor position that doesnt require much supervising
pros: If you like to work with kids than this is a place for you.  Its part time so you can still go to school or have another job.  You feel like you make a difference in the kids lives.
cons: The hours make it hard to plan a school schedule around it.  They are not that flexible in terms of taking time off for unexpected things.

review_title: Horrible management makes it hard to do what you're there for-enhance children's lives.
pros: If you stay away from senior management, you can have an amazing experience being a positive role model for children. It can be invigorating and rewarding to make an impact on youth's daily lives.
cons: Micromanagement. Not open to new ideas. Sense of secrecy and intimidation. No career advancement possibilities and no teamwork or cohesion. Turnover is extremely high.

review_title: One of the most rewarding jobs you can have.
pros: On a daily basis you can change the outlook of a child's life, and this is a great feeling to go home with everyday. I worked for my local branch for almost 8 years. It was a very rewarding experience and I truely believe it improved me as a person.
cons: Sometimes upper management would come down on lower level staff for outlandish reasons. In all fairness there #1 job is child safety and sometimes what you think might be a fun activity can be considered "dangerous" to some.

review_title: Don't Expect to Be Valued - Poor Company Culture
pros: The opportunity to work with and positively impact youth.  Mostly consistent schedule.  You don't have to punch a clock and there are excellent medical/dental/vision/health plans available essentially free through Providence and other partners.  Some of your colleagues are some of the most intelligent, kind, and caring people you will ever meet.  Volunteers are often available and can be helpful as staff support.
cons: They don't invest in their employees whatsoever.  As a full-time, non-exempt employee, I had to negotiate up to making 11.05 p/h.  Part time employees get paid minimum wage.  Raises have to be begged for and are usually met with "it's not in the budget" or, as mine was, "because we paid you more than your original offer, you will have to wait until next year's review".  The "powers at be" do not feel the need to properly compensate well-educated employees, and the direct supervisors do not advocate for their employees.  The people doing the hard work are belittled, passed over, and reported to HR for self-advocacy, while laziness and fraudulent behavior is rewarded and encouraged. There is a culture of mistrust and dishonesty from the board and CEO all the way down the ladder.  They set unrealistic goals for employees with no support from management. In-house and upper level management only appear when special events occur and even the youth are painfully aware of this.

review_title: Great place, great team, great director
pros: I worked as the gym coordinator for the boys and girls club in homer Alaska. Great place to work, fun environment, lots of opportunities to make a positive impact in children's lives and received great support from my director.
cons: The regional management did not give our branch good support and funding therefore it was difficult to carry out the mission for our community.

job_title: Youth Development Professional in Salem, OR
pros: I loved working with the kids. Great happy environment,  where you can go to work knowing it's going to be a fun day
cons: Moving up is pretty hard to do even if you are qualified,  they would rather have their friends in positions than people who do well with kids and have degrees. Seen people get hired for positions they shouldn't have just because they are friends with management,  or friends of a friend

review_title: Try something other than San Bernardino

cons: The administration was very unorganized. While I was there we didn't get paid on time 4 times and they took aways direct deposit while being audited. We were also placed at a school, so had to abide by the rules of 3 different parties.

pros: There is always something to do, and the people I've worked with have all been great! I love that I get to impact the future of the children who come in everyday in a positive way.

pros: always having a reason to smile like when kids run up to you and tell you about their day
cons: under paid for the YDP who really put their all into mentoring the kids

pros:

Can be fun. It's a business of creating a safe and fun atmosphere for children.

Poor work-life balance.
Available resources are rarely enough to meet given goals and objectives.

review_title: Children are wonderful but the organization sucks

cons: Low pay. I have a bachelor degree in sport and Recreation Management and I am only making 8 dollars an hour. The only time you get full time is in the summer. The management is bad too seeing how our club director is under 26.

pros:

job_title: Public Relations Assistant in Tracy, CA

job_title: Youth Development Professional in McAllen, TX

You develop amazing relationships with the kids as well as with the staff. 
They really work with your schedule if you’re a student (college), 
It’s soooo much fun. 
You’re never bored.
cons:
Sometimes it can be stressful when the kids decide not to listen to you. 
It’s a such fast paced environment- you’re always on the go. 
You have to make lesson plans.

job_title: Clubhouse Director in Las Vegas, NV
pros:
Able to make a positive impact on youth.
Clubhouse staff work together as a team.
Fun activities and special events.
Opportunity to be creative in planning programs for kids.
cons:
Questionable decision making from senior management.
Long hours with inadequate staff support.
Management shows favoritism.
Wasteful spending.
Limited room for growth.

pros: Management was great.  My director and assistant director were always willing to work around my school schedule.  They were always very encouraging.

cons: Low pay, long hours with extra work that you aren't compensated for being a salaried employee, the unit director makes for breaks the club for everyone so your experience will really be determined by their ability to manage and lead, was hard to bring issues up without them being looked over

pros: Working together among brilliant, driven, creative and thoughtful individuals. Great people and culture - feels like a family on all levels. Plenty of access for face time and feedback with executives. Opportunities to forge a successful career path within BGCA if you know how to navigate the organization. Access to Clubs and Club professionals help connect national work to the mission.

review_title: Its hard to run a center when HR is making decision with no consideration for the kids or the staff just their pockets
pros: The best part about working for the boys and girls club is getting the opportunity to work hands on with at risk children.

review_title: Boys and girls club job review. The position reviewing  is summer / temporary teen advisor. i loved the job so much.

job_title: Rather Not Disclose in Washington, DC
pros: A defined direction and mission. We have a cohesive team that strives to work closely with the clubs as well as our Board.  We don't 'chase the money' and seek funding that pushes us outside of our organization's mission.  Wonderful coworkers and a strong sense of changing lives. Senior staff is hands-on and extremely dedicated. By far my favorite job.
cons: Located where the 'need' is, our offices are not in the safest neighborhood.

Some are more advanced as far as implementing the new structures and programs. Others are behind the times and have a lot less structure.

pros: The employees are all extremely passionate about their jobs and go out of their way to be there for the children. The board of directors is very involved (in a good way). Your opinion is always valued and you're given the freedom to get creative with your work.
cons: It is a smaller nonprofit so they don't have the largest budget to always get the newest technology.

review_title: Here you truly feel appreciated and you know you are making a difference in the lives of amazing students.
job_title: Youth Development Professional in Austin, TX

cons:
