review_title: My Educational Experience with the East Side Boys&Girls Club of San Antonio
job_title: Assistant Computer Lab Instructor in San Antonio, TX
pros: Wonderful experience working with staff and children. My supervisor was extremely helpful during my first week, and she answered any quetions I had throughout my time with the children.
cons: Any position requires a good deal of patience; as with any child care oriented carrier. For those not accustom to classroom style discipline, repremanding children may be difficult.

job_title: Office Assistant in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: I loved working at BGCHV.  They really set the standards in customer service and child care.  All management is very passionate and is always willing to help you grow.
cons: I wish that there were more full time positions available for admin and pay was low.  However, pay is low because they are a non-profit, which isn't necessarily a con.

review_title: Grant-based positions are a different ball game
pros:
* Ability to do work I loved
* Flexible schedule based on when I taught courses in the community
* Room for growth
cons:
* Because grants are typically implemented for 1- 2 years there is some instability if the grant is not renewed and reshuffling of responsibilities if they like you
* At times the work was too much and at times not enough due to the cyclical nature of programs

review_title: Great Mission, Great Place to work!
pros: Wonderful group of people.  Incredible mission to support.  Flexible work schedules.
cons: Maybe a little top heavy but probably not too different than similar organizations.  Advancement opportunities and career path not so clear for some.

pros:
Fufill a desire to better the lives of kids
Receive a lot of autonomy and ability to be creative in how you achieve youth development goals
cons:
Lack of integrity 
Excessive reporting
Poor decisions by senior leadership
Workload is nearly impossible when understaffed-almost always understaffed

job_title: Summer Camp Counselor in Atlanta, GA
pros: morning or afternoon shifts so you don't work all day and you can plan your summer schedule (flexible), fun co-workers, co-workers are mostly college students and have fun parties outside of work
cons: tiring because working with children from K-6th who have lots of energy, have to create own day plans, good for prospective teachers but bad if you are looking for an easy summer job

pros: None. $9 an hour isn't enough to live on.
cons: $9 an hour for 20 hours a week during term time only is insufficient to live on. Senior staff treat workers as disposable. The work is horrible, trying to force unwilling children to do their homework when they're tired having been in school already 8 hours. No benefits. Constant sicknesses from dirty children. Favoritism for promotions. Promote favorites over ability. They don't tell you when they decide not to open for the day so you only know when you turn up to closed doors. The daily programs provided by head office are uninspiring. The children just are not interested in things that read like lessons instead of fun activities.

pros: They are very dedicated to their cause and take care of their employees.  Being able to administering youth development programs is a great way to make a difference in club members' lives.
cons: Part-time work is generally only available, the pay is low, and there are no benefits but these are the typical downsides for working for a non-profit.

review_title: it was dificult to manage all the kids
pros: you are able to be around kids and watch them grow into something better every year and the managers are very nice when you need help with a problem
cons: there are a lot of kids to deal with and sometimes with the way things are run it can be out of controll

review_title: Held masters-level position at Club for 5.5 years
pros: Being able to be part of the lives of kids and families is amazing. You are able to watch kids grow for multiple years and become a natural extension of a youth's support system. Opportunities to create innovative programs is unequaled in the non profit youth sector. Great brand.
cons: Pay is below the market scale for education and experience. Opportunities for advancement are not good. Too many financial resources are spent on administrators and development staff.

pros: Great experiences working with youth & like-minded co-workers who want to help kids succeed. Lots of support and recognition from co-workers in your unit, but not from upper management.
cons:
Little room for advancement & any advancement that might be made is much more work than you will be compensated for.
Low starting pay. Some facilities are in poor condition.

pros: Great environment for those enjoy working with children. I worked as a volunteer teacher, and was given a lot of freedom and flexibility, which I enjoyed.
cons: Management is always so busy they had little time to assist me, but this is expected as the focus should be on the kids. Hours are ambiguous, which could be both a pro and a con.

pros: Employees at BGCMV are there because they have a passion for bettering kids' lives. The administration is always trying to balance kids' and staff needs with the funding they have available. I felt valued and cared for, and my schedule was very flexible.
cons: Like most nonprofits, the pay could be better. Sometimes there was lack of communication between administrative staff and direct workers. I think this has changed a lot since I left the organization.

job_title: Youth Development Professional in Severn, MD
pros: Making a difference in children's lives
cons: overworked employees, management didn't do anything unless it involves a water park or movies or an event. Only respects their concerns and ideas, and not the people actually involved with the children 8 hours a day.

review_title: Long hours, low pay, but the kids can make it worth it.
pros:
You get to work with underprivileged children and feel like you are making a difference.  
You can move from part-time to full time if you make an effort and express interest;
cons:
Very low pay (it is a non-profit company).
Very hard to get time off (no paid vacation for first year).

job_title: Program Aide in Las Vegas, NV
pros: You get a real sense of accomplishment helping out the youth who need guidance. I had a great manager who was clear and concise with what he expected out of the staff, which was to always put the kids first. A fun environment to work in, kids are awesome.
cons: Dealing with admin sometimes can be a pain as they are not down in the trenches to understand staff's needs.

review_title: My experience at the Boys and Girls Club was fulfilling.
pros: Great schedule, fun work environment, worked with great people. Many of the children we worked with had problems at home, if you could make their day a little bit better than you accomplished something. Made some good friends with the people I worked with.
cons: Room for advancement was not there. I had management experience that others did not and was passed over for promotions.

pros: I love working at the Boys and Girls Club! It's a really good company and I love being apart of their growing lives. From doing activities with them to listening to their problems, it's always something interesting. There is so much opportunity available for employees and there is always something new to learn.
cons: It's hard to work here if you're a full time student. It's important to always be on your feet so if all of your energy is gone, your job feels hard.

pros: Worked for the Red River Valley Boys and girls club while in school.  One of the best work experiences that i have ever had. Staff were amazing and treated their youth workers great.
cons: To be honest, there was nothing that I did not like which working for this organization. Well structured from top to bottom.

job_title: Part Time Program Aide in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Interacting with the kids, awesome staff, employee suggestions welcomed and encouraged, educational and engaging activities, safety is a huge priority
cons: Takes a while to learn so many names, but totally worth it. You have to be alert and observant of many things in a large area at once (not a con really, just takes time to build that skill)

job_title: Director of Development in Brea, CA
pros: Some of the best,good hearted,smart people work here. Family environment,leadership and on going training a plus! They really hire a culturally diverse group of staff.  Which benefits the kids that go there for care.  Great internship programs available. Very reputable organization.
cons: As with many non profits,the pay is super low,  too many hats for 1 employee,plus  No medical benefits for most employees,and no opportunity to participate in a 401k program. 😣

pros: You get to help so many underprivileged kids here. They are so intelligent and full of animation. It's a rewarding experience that you will carry with you for a lifetime!
cons: It can be overwhelming as a senior counselor. There was quite a bit of responsibility involved. Creating and maintaining the curriculum involves long hours...even after you go home.

review_title: Responsible for positively impacting children’s day to day experiences. Mostly working with the younger groups of kids.
job_title: Program Assistant in Hilton Head Island, SC
pros: Cute kids, get to have meaningful relationships with them where they can depend on you. Get to teach the kids cool projects sometimes.
cons: No training - my first day I was just thrown into the job with 35+ k-2nd grade students and had no clue what to do. No real room for growth within the company.

review_title: A mission you can stand by
job_title: Director of Development in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great mission! If you find working with youth rewarding, working at BGCA or a local BGC is the job for you!
cons: Often local affiliates struggle with structure, fundraising, and staffing. Can be frustrating. Nationally, there is a bit of a good ol boy system that caters to long standing employees and not always in the name of bringing the best, most knowledgeable talent to the table.

job_title: After School Program Staff in Long Beach, CA
pros: Working with the kids is the most rewarding aspect of this position.  If you have childcare experience, getting the job is easy.
cons: the pay isn't worth it, only $9.00 an hour ,  plus you have to pay $60-75 for CPR and first aid certification, in which the company will not reimburse you for. There is no training, they expected me to know their operations the day I started and was disciplined because I had no training.

pros: Some of the best reasons to work for Boys & Girls Club were that you felt that you were changing the lives of some kids that were in real need.
cons: Some of the downsides of working for the Boys and Girls Club were that a lot of kids were very bad mannered and took time to get them to respect you.

pros:
-You know you're creating a big difference in the lives of the kids that attend the club
-Typically a unit director won't micromanage your work. You have some freedom in choosing the best way to interact with and create programs for members
cons:
-Being a non-profit, even the hourly pay could be higher
-There is still frequent employee turnover, which can make structure and uniform rules difficult

pros: If you love to work with children ages six through thirteen and don't mind helping with their homework, life problems, and helping them resolve issues among themselves than this is the perfect job for you.
cons: You don't like working everyday Monday through Friday about twenty-five to thirty hours or so a week and you lack patience, social skills, and the drive to withstand temper tantrums and just the typical rambunctious behaviors of many children at one time then it's not the type of occupation for you.

pros: The organization and its employees believe in the mission. The ability to see the change you bring about in youth is an amazing experience. People work here for the children, which is how it should be.
cons: Pay wasn't the best. Professional development was lacking. Not much room for growth. Local organizations need to understand that investing in your employees brings on positive change and development.

pros: Great pay for a non-profit however there's no room to grow.  The current President is amazing and very personable.  The benefits package is awesome.
cons: Upper level management, not good.  The same people have been in the same positions forever and it's difficult for them to embrace chance.

job_title: Teacher Assistant in Jersey City, NJ
pros: Staff are nice and organized. All the people around would like to assist and support your work. Besides, it's pleasant to work with the lovely kids.
cons: As a part-time teacher, I did not have many chances to experience the downsides. I would say the management here was more of flexibility than formality, which was hard to tell it's good or bad.

pros: If you want a typical and fun camp counselor job at a sleep-away camp, this one is for you. You get to spend almost all of your time with kids, soak in the beautiful redwoods of Mendocino, and make lots of friends.
cons: Could be stressful at times, like when you're understaffed.

review_title: Must love working with children from 6-18
pros: Monday through Friday workdays.  If school is closed for a holiday, The Club is usually closed.  Paid time off after some years.
cons: Some clubs require 2 years of college to get hired and they usually don't pay more than $10/hour.  When I worked there, there was no health insurance for part timers.

pros: It was rewarding to see growth in kids, and the staff was all really nice
cons: It was difficult to grow within the company, and depending on the area of the club it can change your whole opinion on the experience. Some clubs have great kids and staff, others have the worst of the worst.

review_title: Organization is top heavy. Proving true ROI for investors is difficult
pros: Long history of success in youth services area. Great mission to serve kids. Engaged & diverse Board of Governors
cons: Exceptionally poor change management practices. Values are enforced during reviews but inconsistently adhered to by leadership. Organization and communication issues persist. National priorities over providing local value

review_title: Fun and exciting opportunity to be a positive influence to kids.
pros: I enjoy being able to work with children of all ages. The athletics departments are most exciting; teaching kids how to play sports as well as proper sportsmanship and teamwork is fun.
cons: Sometimes the children can be a bit overwhelming. You really need to have patience to work with large groups of different ages.

review_title: Great Bonding with the Kids and their Families, Not So Great Management
pros: Teaching kids, bonding with them and their families. The co-workers were nice and fun to be around as well. Everyone got along for the most part and always helped eachother when needed.
cons: Constantly undergoing new management. Very unorganizd. Usually always had to work overtime, but they did not allow overtime pay after a while.

review_title: Working at BGCSF was a satisfying and rewarding experience
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: They really care about the youth they are serving. The majority of the staff are fun to work with and care deeply for the youth.
cons: Leadership is top heavy and promotions are hard to come by. Severly understaffed so everyone is overworked with a high burnout rate.

review_title: How not to run a nonprofit organization
job_title: Program Director-Teens in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Working with children, inspiring young minds to reach their goals, and laid back working environment.
cons: Lack of funding, inefficient and ineffective business model. The BGC is centrally concerned about membership numbers. They fail to track program impact, student performance, outcomes. There is virtually no formal training provided to new employees, particularly those in management positions. Due to the lack of funding, staff is forced to take on multiple job duties. Pay is not competitive and

pros: Where else can have the potential to be an essential, active  part of this many youth. You become invested in the relationships that you have the opportunity to build and grow together.
cons:
Ongoing leadership and management training should be mandatory. 
Charters should adhere to national job descriptions and HR practices.

pros: Working with kids and getting to take them on field trips. Loved being able to help them with their homework and interact with the parents.
cons: not great pay, can be stressful, coworkers definitely form cliques (this definitely goes for management too), didn't give me the hours they promised.

pros: The Club is safe place to play and meet new friends.  Hardworking staff and volunteers. Learn great programs for kids
cons: The salary is not great because of the lack of funding.  The venue is operated out od an annex school and is a little old. Little space but it's enough to run its programs.

pros: I worked at the Boys & Girls Club for many years and always appreciated the sense of family among staff members. We were always so close and would often hang out outside of work. I feel as though I will always have a place with them. No one ever really leaves. It's a place that stays with you forever. This is also a great place to work for college students!
cons: The salaries are minimal due to it being a smaller organization.

review_title: Not For The Faint of Heart
job_title: Child Development Associate in Seattle, WA
pros: Great staff, pretty decent benefits, kids can be fun. Everyday is a new day there, and you may find strengths that you never knew you had.
cons: Low pay, very disorganized, kids can also be a ton of work. There is a lot of miscommunication from higher up with regards to compensation and planning.

review_title: Pretty good job right out of college, on a gap year etc.
pros: 4 day work week, long breaks, potentially free rustic housing, free meals during the week, beautiful location, summers off to go travel or do whatever. Good to get resume skills for a park ranger job.
cons: Long hours (8 am - 10:30 pm), seasonal job so need to find more employment in summer, no benefits.

pros:
- Starting salary is $13.00/hr
- Flexible to work at home and onsite
cons:
- Management has no sense of direction or clear expectations for anything. 
- Higher ups do not discuss what they believe should be priority and leave it for you to figure out who to listen to/what project to prioritize instead of them communicating and then passing information along to you.

pros: Great programs for the kids and serves a special need; nice people work there; staff is very invested in the kids despite the management practices.
cons: COO is racist, arrogant, sneaky and clueless.  CEO is not trustworthy.  Benefits are okay if you get to be full-time but they try to keep everyone at part-time so they don't have to pay for benefits. People work very hard there with the expectation of continued hard work and no end in sight.  Support from upper management is lip-service.  Very stressful environment...I was lucky to leave when I did before the hatchet started falling!

review_title: Not bad place to work, Must be really passionate about kids
pros: Cool staff that work together to make it a fun place for the kids; many opportunities to make your own programs; sometimes a very fun environment to work in. great parttime work for those just out of high school or just graduated from college/
cons: no upward mobility; no benefits for part-time staff; few full-time staff opportunities; very low pay (depends on where you work)

pros: Teaching children new skills, helping create inclusive programs for kids with special needs. The kids are for sure the best part.
cons: Very low compensation for the work and experience  involved. Lack of overall communication, Horrible management from senior staff, no growth potential, lack of training and necessary resources, they also expect you to work overtime regularly with no overtime pay. Terrible organization culture and structure.

pros: help younger generation become responsible adults. You are a role model that has a great impact on the children of the future.
cons: it takes a lot of patience to work with younger children. Also being at a new club it is hard to get the respect from the members.

review_title: The kids are great. The supervisors...not so much.
pros: The kids are awesome. They will change your life. It is inspiring to see how they persevere through such difficult home lives. All you'll want to do is help them.
cons: The pay sucks. Some of the programs we have to run are lame. Sometimes the supervisors forget what it's like to be a part-time staff. Try to require too much out of you but pay doesn't match up to job responsibilities.

pros: Everyone in this organization believes in the mission of enabling all young people, especially those who need us most, to reach their full potential as productive, caring, responsible citizens. You work on fundraising events and learn about the programs that help the children that go there. It really makes a difference in these kids lives.
cons: There really isn't any advancement opportunities and there is no compensation for interns and volunteers. It's quite a bit of work and you have to be patient.

pros: It's great for college students. It's a very rewarding job It's a fantastic opportunity for those wanting to work with children.  It's very flexible environment in that there is some autonomy to what you can do each day
cons: It's seems very unorganized. The pay isn't great. It's a very stressful job for a near minimum wage job.

pros: Nothing is more rewarding than molding the youth to reach their full potential. I enjoy watching children come in very shy the first day of kindergarten, then grow into outgoing 2nd graders.
cons: Working with children, each day is unpredictable. It can become a bit much to deal with a over populated class room of young children.

review_title: A great Job if you love kids!
pros:
* absolutely changing lives in low income communities.
* Opportunity to give back
* You will learn alot about grants and non-profit organizations
cons:
* Alot of office politics
* the top three leaders of the organization are all family. Two sisters and one of the sisters daughter. They have each others back endlessly and you will be wrong no matter what you say or do
* There is no HR department

pros:
-You really get to make a difference in children's lives and get to help them develop their minds and behavior.
-Part time is great for college students taking courses
cons:
-Working with kids is not for everyone. It can get extremely stressful.
-Its great for teens out of high school, but for many, there isn't a whole lot of growth within the company.
-Sometimes the kid to staff ratio gets out of hand and there isn't enough staff to cover the amount of kids signed in.

review_title: It's a little disorganized but the Boys & Girls Club is a great organization that helps so many kids and teens succeed!
pros:
- Passion driven work
- Working with teenagers
- Planning development
- New skillet gained
- Presentations
- The job is not very grueling and it doesn't require an excessive amount of work even though you are standing most of the time
cons:
- Limited flexibility
- Very few hours
- Disorganization
- As far as management, planning and coordination of campus tours, university presentations, etc. could be improved

review_title: For a good experience focus on local NOT national.
job_title: Director of Major Gifts in Orlando, FL
pros: Good mission, dedicated staff with focus on getting the work done. Colleagues are mostly genuine and committed to their work.
cons: Lack of trust in capable staff and managers that are in over their heads is killing staff moral. Moreover the HR function is poor and doesn’t give employees a way in which to present valid grievances. Favoritism is the order of the day.

review_title: I had the best experience working with BGCA this summer!
job_title: Youth Development Professional in Garden City, ID
pros: Management was amazing! Anne Westfall and Noel Buldoc are amazing women who prioritize everyone's success. I also had no trouble finding friends among coworkers, which can sometimes be difficult. The shared goals that we set as staff kept us focused on our mission and brought us closer as a team.
cons: The pay was just above minimum wage. For the certifications, qualifications, and the staff:child ratio, the pay did not always seem sufficient.

review_title: Great if you like kids! Definitley in need of more staff.
job_title: Elementary Education Coordinator in Goshen, IN
pros: Creating and running fun yet educational programming that kids enjoy. Offers PTO to part time staff. Great place if you are hoping to continue your education or move up in the company.
cons: Always short on staff, which made it more difficult to accomplish everything needed in one day. Pay can be decent compared to a lot of jobs but considering it is not a full time position, it can make things difficult.

review_title: Excellent organization providing an invaluable resource to our future generation
pros: Our children are in need of the village of old.... where everyone knew your name and cared about each other as if they were cherished family members
cons: Expectations are high and monetary compensation is not. Most likely the part-time role will be insufficient to be sole source of paying bills......

review_title: It was a very lively place to work and it is only as fun as you want to make it. It takes some creativity.
pros: It's a very rewarding feeling to work here. I left almost every day feeling like I did something good just by being there.
cons: Working with kids all day every day wears you down.

review_title: Greatly providing a fresh hot meal for the future of America
job_title: Cooks Or Food Specialist in Charleston, WV
pros: Was Great to incorporate a hot meal program instead watching the kids get chips, dollar store candies and cupcakes. It was a great experience to watch and work with some state of the art kitchen technology,
cons: To get paid minimum wage was very disrespectful considering the skill level required.

pros:
The best and most afordable place for young people ages 5 - 18 in the industry.
Staff develop life-long relationships with young members and their families.
School education is reinforced and age appropriate life-skills training is available to members.
Exposure to mental, as well as physical activities results in more rounded individuals.
Continuous program training.
Great organization to work for if you like young people.
cons: Cons are personal and based on location and management.

job_title: Program Assistant in Hilton Head Island, SC
pros: Amazing to work with the children and help them develop. As part of my duties I was able to share my love for the outdoors with the children I supervised.
cons: No time to plan for activities as the management demanded we do at work, on the clock, but expected us to only show up when the children were there. Too many leaders pulling staff different directions without having one plan in mind.

review_title: The organization has given me the opportunity to run a program to fulfill our members potential.
pros: Rewarding to provide a fun program and learning experience for our kids. The main focus is the safety of our kids. The relationships we build with the kids change their lives. We give support to parents with resources.
cons: There’s lack of appreciation. You may give a lot of effort but not be recognized. All the work done for our kids does not reflect in our pay.

review_title: This job teaches a lot of fundamentals and qualities to further growth in both kids and adults alike.
pros: Gaining experience in a fast paced working environment & Learning how to work with children of all ages gives me a unique perspective on other fields of work tremendously.
cons: Doesn’t pay enough, training on certain situations doesn’t get implemented well enough & not enough structure between the higher ups & staff.

pros: BGCA has a great mission. There are a lot of good people that work at this organization.
cons: Overall, the environment is surprisingly stressful, inconsistent and chaotic. Generally, morale is very low among employees. Unfortunately, many people who work at the national office are disconnected from the mission.

job_title: Summer Camp Counselor and Swim Instructor in San Diego, CA
pros: I worked in the greater San Diego region at the pool in the morning and the summer camp in the afternoon. Overall it was a solid summer job, they did their best to accommodate what branch and camp you were placed in. The work schedule was always published in a timely manner.
cons: Frequently campers parents were late to pick up and everyone was expected to stay without being paid, but parents were never "punished" for consistently showing up late.

review_title: Love the Kids, hate the Infrastructure
pros: The kids, the coworkers there are good. People are really nice
cons:
Low pay
Hours get cut all the time
Inconsistent communication
Disorganized
Too much structure and making kids do things they don't want to do while simultaneously saying that we help them make choices!
Lack of supplies

job_title: Facilities Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Amazing leadership, amazing staff & an amazing organization!
cons: It is a nonprofit. Obviously, working for a nonprofit is NOT about getting rich.  One is asked to sacrifice their spare time on occasion.(This isn't a "con" to me. I am compelled to inform the interested that this is what nonprofits are about if one chooses to work for this type of organization. Simply put, this isn't about you. It is about the children.)

review_title: Fun Eperience to Learn About Yourself
job_title: Site Manager in New York, NY
pros: Experiencing working with at risk youth, management, creating ideas, and easy for college students.
cons: Noise level, can get crowded, sometimes working with school for the space for the program, and some staff who like to get on their phones.

pros: The environment is really laid back and the club I worked out was very diverse.  The athletic director at my branch was one of the best people I've ever worked with
cons: New management was a bit of an issue my last year at this job, and some of the part time staff are treated with a bias for an unknown reason.

job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Richmond, VA
pros: Working with the kids is truly the best part. You have to be patient and kind. You also have to understand that some of these kids have problematic lifestyles
cons: Honestly their are no cons of working to for this company, that you wouldn't have at any other company. This company is amazing in every way!

pros: Excellent opportunity to make a difference in children's lives; the mission this company pursues is absolutely outstanding. Keep up the good work!
cons: Often understaffed, would typically have 3 to 4 employees managing over 30 children. Parents were often very difficult to deal with sometimes.

review_title: 3 CEOs in 7 years that hire unqualified COOs
pros:
Kids are tremendous, and thrive in clubs 
Actual clubs are where real work happens 
Directors work extremely hard to provide services in community.
Providing a safe place for Youth is really the focus at the club level 
A lot of support at the local level
cons:
Good ole boys system in senior management 
Terrible accountability of executive staff 
Top down leadership that doesn’t really support what sites need

job_title: Group Leader in San Diego, CA
pros: The company really cares about their employees and the children. There was something new to learn and I looked forward to everyday working there. Every week we had meetings that helped train us and addressed any questions or concerns we had. It is such a rewarding feeling to be a part of the kids lives.
cons: The after school hours can be conflicting if you don't have a flexible schedule

review_title: Great Part time place, no potential to advance
pros: If you like kids and like having potential fun this is the place for you. Pay is hourly and lunch is paid but you have to work though it.
cons: Kids can be crazy someday and its stressful knowing management and parents expect you to be a dang champ at micromanaging 50-60 kids at a time.

job_title: Membership Coordinator in San Pedro, CA
pros: I'm an alumni from this Clubhouse, the highlight of my day is watching the members come through the double doors feeling welcomed!
cons: It's extremely difficult to not get attached to the members, from the youngest to the oldest. Everyone is going through obstacles, I can only do my best to guide and mentor them and lead by example.

pros: Great Mission  and Great staff to work with. Its a privilege to help youth fulfill their full potential. I believe in there mission and support their efforts.
cons: Low Salary and Benefits, there is an extreme high turn over rate in the organization. The management in top heavy. Upper management does not seem to care much about the other staff.

review_title: My experience with The Boys & Girls Club has been inspiring.
pros: I have 4 years of experience working in this great organization. I have worked closely with children and love building a relationship with them.
cons: The challenge of of working in this organization is to get the members and families to buy into your vision. It’s hard to gain the trust of the community but very easy to lose their trust as well.

review_title: I helped children with homework, and ran outside activities
pros:
Get paid to play
The children can be fun
great co workers
you get to go on trips with the children
Free shirts, and hats
cons: The children can be mean and rude at times.  Their is almost no chance of pay raises, neither is their any chance to get decent raises or make more than $50,000.  When it comes down to it.  Its a dead end job.

pros: Great leadership on-site. You can see the difference you are making with each club member!
cons: Central office leaders tend to favor some sites over other sites. A lack of communication between central office and each individual club.

review_title: Good Money. Good Place to Work at over The Summer
pros:
Good Food.
Plenty of Water for children and Workers
Activities Everyday
Camp Experience
cons:
Lack of Communication
Lack of Experience Workers
Strict Rules for Certain people that was put on Everyone but the people in charge
Favoritism
Lack Of Professionalism  
Repetitive Activities no Originality
Small Meals for Workers as if we where the size of children

review_title: A few professional volunteers away from greatness
pros: Serving the youth of the greater Richmond area is extremely needed and rewarding. You can make a tangible difference in the world everyday. Being a part of the solution to solve many of our at risk community's problems.
cons: Extremely Long hours, low community resources, finding dynamic employees for very low wages. Keeping the dynamic employees for long.

pros: It's a rewarding job especially counseling the children and seeing them achieve great things. One of the things I loved the most is that I got to coach basketball and you can have an immediate impact
cons: The majority of the management are not innovative and tend to not let the counselors have quality innovative control when it comes to creating activities for the children.

pros: The organization provides a great service to the community; the kids we serve are phenomenal and our staff are a blast to work with.  The culture is fair and they're working on fair wages on a non-profit level.
cons: Work-life balance is way off when you're not a base level staff.  You're asked to pour everything into the job at the risk of your personal relationships.

review_title: I quit because of clique-ish co-workers
pros: Freedom to make your own activities with the kids ( the kids and the actual job I signed up for was awesome!)
cons: The environment at this site was very discouraging and unprofessional, especially with their attitude towards the kids and eachother. I felt embarrassed showing excitement and enthusiasm for my job when everyone else thought the cool thing to do was pretend they didn’t want to be there. I couldn’t be around people who didn’t seem very dedicated to the kids other than on a very shallow and casual level.

review_title: A job you'll never want to leave
job_title: Youth Development Professional in Roy, UT
pros: It is so rewarding and you form a bond with every child there, most of which really need a good mentor in their lives. All of the staff are really close as well so it's super fun and doesn't feel like work.
cons: It is nonprofit so you don't get paid much. I did it through Americorps and got paid a bit more. Also they aren't the best at communicating.

pros: The opportunity to mentor children and change lives is priceless!
cons: Management and administrative decisions are last-minute and strenuous on the staff! Be prepared to give up multiple weekends for obligated 'volunteer work'. Children to staff ratio is 50:1.

review_title: Summer Work at Boys & Girls Club
pros:
- Easy-going atmosphere that is welcoming
- Fulfilling to contribute to a place that helps children
- Strong national system and name recognition
cons:
- Facilities are not always the nicest
- The work is not always well-defined
- Often unorganized and/ or chaotic depending on number of kids

job_title: Program Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
- Compelling mission and impact
- Great colleagues
- Competitive salary and benefits in the non-profit sector
cons:
- Toxic leadership, abysmal management
- Untenable workloads
- Bottlenecks and chaos
- Leadership unaware or unconcerned about extremely low morale/high attrition

review_title: The kids are amazing, but depending on who your service director is it the club may be ran in a disorganized fashion.
pros:
The kids.
Free food at times. 
The events.
Opportunities to move up
cons:
They exploit the story of club members for a national competition. Many times they make the children lie to make the stories juicer. 
Lack of supervisor training.
The unequal distribution of money. 
Extremely low pay even though money is always being donated to the organization. 
No benefits.

review_title: Great Organization for Those Who Love to Work with Kids
pros: Strong CEO, Most employees are invested in doing a great job, emphasizes BGCA values as well as bgcconejo values, good job for those looking to see if a career in education is right for them.
cons: Organizational cohesion needs improvement, some competitors may offer better compensation/benefits for same or similar role.

job_title: Program Coordinator in West Bend, WI
pros:
Loved Working with kids 
Developed patient mind 
Talked to many parents 
Leading other staff in activities
cons: Kids are mentally and emotionally draining. They require the total effort. If you are good for that then the job is amazing which I was.

review_title: My experience working at Southside Boys and Girls Club was great.
pros: The environment was great. Everybody got along with each other. The children enjoyed coming there.
cons: We had a lot of unexpected changes, but nothing to serious. Some of the field trips were unorganized, but came together at the end.

review_title: Head coach allowed me to develop my own coaching style and trust me when developing lesson plans.
pros: Athletes were easy to work with. Well stablished swimming school which allowed beginer swimmers to easily be promoted onto the swim team. Meets mileage was paid according to IRS guidelines.
cons: Difficult place to develop an administrative career. Low hourly rate compared to assigned responsibilities. Poor organizational skills fom upper management.

job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Mansfield, TX
pros: the staff all worked together each day to let the kids have fun and enjoy themselves and also at the same time learning and growing.
cons: some kids can be a challenge but just know that they just need someone to listen to them and the only way they know to get attention is by being a trouble maker. So don't differentiate among kids treat them all equally.

pros: good place to work if you like to mentor children and like sports. A lot of different things to learn and cool field trips and sometimes roads trips.
cons: Set salary. No overtime, main supervisor is an jerk with favoritism and no respect. Different units get different privileges. The workshops suck.

pros: Some of the reasons I enjoyed working for the Boys and Girls Club of the Midlands is because I had the opportunity to work with some wonderful people.
cons: One of the downsides to the employment was that it was a part time job and I only was able to work four hours a day.

review_title: Amazing company, surprisingly great employer paid benefits
pros: Working with the community, they promote from within, flexible schedule. The company is always growing and is team oriented. The staff, parents and children on site are amazing to work with as well.
cons: Some Club locations are not the safest. Supervisors are understandably busy so they are not always there to directly support. Still great company.

pros: I had great, helpful coworkers. I was excited about the purpose and goals of the after school program helping the kids.
cons: A little disorganized at times. Also as someone who was also a student while working there part time it was hard to come up with enough engaging programs.

pros: Ive worked for a few non-profits and this one by far is one of my favorites to work for! It had an amazing culture and everyone from part-time staff to administrative level staff are all there to really support the kids and make a bright future for them.
cons: In my experience, there were some organization problems that needed to be confronted but other than that there really is no bad side to this job!

pros: Good people, and you are doing a job that gives your plenty of satisfaciton becasue it is a non-profit organization
cons: the bad part is that it is a non-prpfit organization so there is not alot of room for fast achievements and high rewards are few

review_title: It is a great environment but the is not that much
pros: It is fun working with kid, get to go on a lot of field trips for free, and only work three hours a weekday.
cons: You only get three hours a day, and depending on your site coordinator determines how much fun you will have

review_title: exciting but exhusting on some days
pros: You get to work with kids from all different walks of life.  Just knowing that your impacting someones life in positive way is always a good feeling.
cons: Some days it can be hectic. when staff are short and the numbers of kids is increasing, it can be a lot.

pros: Great opportunity to work with kids to change and save their lives, fun work environment, worked with great people. Great place to build your skills with working with youth.
cons:
Could be stressful at times, working with kids of all ages can be tricky at times. 
Part-time was the downfall to be sole source of paying bills
Unorganized at times

pros: Mission-focused work that directly impacts the lives of youth; opportunities for professional development; innovative, new talent coming on board merging with tenured staff creates a better balance in ways of work, strategy and best practices
cons: Workloads can be challenging, but the organization is consciously moving toward a shift in priorities and alignment of responsibilities to improve upon work/life balance

pros: getting to work with the children was a very fun experience. You really feel like your making a difference in these children's lives.
cons: You may not always be placed in a good area.  Some staff is under trained  which can be very frustrating.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Leandro, CA
pros:
Positive impact on young kids lives
Get to work with diverse groups of kids
Shared values
Progressive thinking about education
cons:
Upper management lacks connection with on site management 
No staff relationship between local schools 
Management onsite is overworked, under control of upper management with no real ability to make decisions without affecting their jobs...favoritism

review_title: Great if you want to be a teacher and have a LOT of patience
pros: The staff and Supervisors are a great team to work with. Everyone is supportive and helpful and love what they do. The job makes you think out of the box in creative ways. If you want a career in teaching this job will help you get there.
cons: Some of the children there will try your patience. You must have great classroom management.

review_title: Boys and Girls Clubs of Greater Milwaukee
pros: The members are the best. You'll get attached rather quickly.
cons: Lack of advancement. The company has moved from being all about the kids to being run as a business and the kids are an afterthought.  Frontline staff are not treated very well or valued even though they are the reason the members come everyday.

review_title: People weren't as friendly as I thought they would be
pros: Fun field trips to go on with the kids, good locations and parking, some kids are very appreciative of you
cons: Coworkers were not very welcoming. Managers played favorites big time. Pay is awful, literally minimum wage for long hours. Work was tedious sometimes because you are supervising the kids for hours on end, stuck in just one room.

review_title: National Movement offers Passion, local management varies
pros: Passionate movement, outstanding national training track, national networking and career opportunities, dedicated employees commited to changing lives of youth in America
cons: local career advancement can be limited, local training & management can be inconsistant with national norms with no penalties or repercussions

pros: I love my club members, it is really nice to have a job where I know I make a difference in someone's life
cons: Not enough training available. I got thrown into this position with no training and almost no supervision

pros: Decent pay and benefits, enjoy most of my colleagues, never seems to be an issue with taking vacation
cons: Heavy workload, must wear multiple hats due to minimal staffing, I've had both good and really bad managers- so it just depends, not as many opportunities for advancement

pros: The organization has a mission that cannot be beat.  There are wonderful people who work here, but unfortunately, hardly any of them are in management.
cons:
The organization is trending in the wrong direction.  New CFO came in and slowly started replacing the few talented, relatively new employees with this odd collection of buddies who all worked together at Home Depot.  We got to watch honest people put their trust in these new employees and get completely backstabbed.  For some reason, the people chosen to be kept around are the ones who are divisive and terrible leaders.  The short version is talented, trustworthy coworkers you enjoy got fired while dishonest, divisive coworkers you cringe when they take over a meeting without a clue got kept around.  

Senior leadership seems completely disassociated from the plight of the workers.  Middle management is the worst though.  This place has turned from a mission oriented organization for everyone to a fundraising organization for the upper management.  That's all they seem to care about, and that team is treated and allowed to function as the golden child.  There is no accountability for them while the rest of us live in fear of getting canned next, simply for asking the wrong question at a meeting or for not giving our complete support to people we don't trust.

review_title: Great experience. I would highly recommend working for the local Boys & Girls Club.
pros: The Boys & Girls Club is wonderful place to begin as your first job. As a person that grew up in the Boys & Girls Club, being able to help children much like yourself is a wonderful experience.
cons: Long hours. Sometimes it gets a little hectic as most organizations do that help hundreds of kids on a daily basis.

review_title: Overall a pretty good place to work.
job_title: Summer Camp Counselor in Rehoboth, MA
pros:
You work goes to a good cause. 
It is very easy to develop strong relationships with other employees.
The work is very rewarding
cons: They are pretty cheap. They find any way they can to pay their employees the least amount. Having said that, it's not uncommon for this to be the case with non-profits

review_title: Good work, the kids are sometimes a headache though
pros: Pay is decent for part-time, great job for college students as it is usually 3PM-8PM, and the work is overall easy
cons: The kids are usually low- income :(, no upward mobility

review_title: I worked as a Youth Development Coordinator over the summer in the Learning Center
job_title: Youth Development Staff in Rogers, AR
pros: Great staff members, they only hire people who truly care about the kids. I learned so much about how to manage and plan and handle kids.
cons: Not much room to advance, and not as well organized in management as I would have liked

pros: Great management, rewarding work, a lot of employee development. Excellent opportunity for recent high school and college graduates looking to make a difference.
cons: Not a lot of room for promotion in certain cities. As with most nonprofits pay is too low to make a comfortable living.

pros: The boys and girls club is a great employer. When you work there you really feel like you are making a difference. Flexible hours. Summer off or work full time
cons: LOW PAY. No chance of raises.  Ran by board of directors. Hire turnover. Management changes frequently. LOW PAY

job_title: Game Room Attendant in Chattanooga, TN
pros: The relationships you build with the kids and the differences you can make are huge pros to the job. Another pro is the easy hours.
cons: There are a lot of restrictions put on you when dealing with the kids. You are also dealing with kids who have very difficult pasts and it is difficult to deal with that sometimes.

pros: The kids are awesome. Getting to influence a kids life and change the way they look at things by teaching them skills and showing them a part of yourself is life changing for yourself and the kids.
cons: Having to call DHS. The administration running this club. The lack of moral amongst employees. No employee reviews. No pay raises. Favorites played amonst staff by admins.

pros: The kids where great and we always made it through the chaos. Great coworkers and we always found a way to make the days work eventually.
cons: Scheduling was very poor for activities for the children and wasn't facilitated to all employees. Became a problem when only certain coworkers were able to drive the vans and they weren't there.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Met some nice people  who care about the kids.
cons: Promotions from within were common, except it had more to do with who liked you than if you were qualified for the position.  One person had been there for years and still had no idea what she was doing.  She spent her time blaming everyone else for her failings.  Pay was way below average and other people were hired and paid more.  If you tried to use the little bit of PTO you got, you were looked down on.

pros: Get to have a lot of control when deciding what to do and get to hang out with kids. Also, great atmosphere. No weekends!
cons: Limited budget for planning, limited hours, low pay but understandable. Sometimes you get stuck with a lot of kids at one time due to low budget to hire enough hourly employees to stay where you’re supposed to be at 15 kids per adult

job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Frederick, OK
pros: Working with kids, helping with the daily struggles of being a kid. Fostering a great future.
cons: Number one pay. We all inherently love children, for it mainly why we picked the job, but the pay is such a turn off to many qualified people who would be a great addition to the team. We have lost many site directors over the years, and in many cases, money was a factor.

pros: Some of the kids are really sweet
cons: Minimum wage, often no breaks, no appreciation from higher ups, the nightmare kids ruin it, parents for the most part don't care, administration never takes complaints seriously, no accountability for directors and administration, takes a lot of mental fortitude, exhausting. no advancement opportunities.

pros: I was paid decently, I got first dibs on donated items, and I got to listen to music all day. I liked my employers and it was a good job for summer/winter breaks.
cons: There's no real air conditioning in the warehouse, so it can be a pretty gross and sweaty job during a Texas summer. You don't make much more than minimum wage, so I wouldn't do anything long-term.

review_title: Chandler, AZ Boys & Girls Club not the most welcoming place.
pros: The hours are pretty flexible and the dress is very relaxed
cons: Employees are hostile toward newcomers and the overall environment is not welcoming.

review_title: Good job for those who love kids.
pros: Set hours and schedule, teaches you patience and leadership skills, your able to benefit the community and children's lives, a lot of the work can be pretty fun (such as planning art projects or games for the kids).
cons: Low pay, hardly any resources to work with, management was not great.

review_title: Teachers assistant working with children. Great experience and very rewarding.
pros: There is a strong connection with students. It trains you to handle people from different aspects of life, ranging from children to faculty. Great for future educators.
cons: Working with children could sometimes be tricky. If they have issues, they will be very hard to deal with. There can be injuries on site that you need to be prepared for at all time.

job_title: Web Content Editor in Hapeville, GA
pros: Great benefits for a non-profit, great employees, great mission. When the youth are being presented, it really touches your heart about the great things the organization has accomplished.
cons: Becoming more and more corporate; fundraising is obscuring the mission of helping youth. Employees being treated lesser as compared to the past.

pros: It is enriching to be a positive impact in the lives of the youth or next generation. The staff is wonderful too, a lot of teamwork.
cons: The pay is too little for the nature of the work. Better benefits. More hours. The maximum amount of hours shouldn't be 22.5

job_title: Youth Professional Developer in Kirtland, NM
pros: The kids are amazing! They all grow on you and its enjoyable to be around them even the trouble makers. The best job that brings out the kid in you.
cons: They have poor leadership in management. Too many rules are installed where it feels the kids are transitioning from school to more schooling at the club. They are more interested in making smart money making future adults than good honest future adults.

pros:
The people you work with are like family.
You get to do interesting things every now and then.
It's a great cause.
cons: Really no complaints. The only thing I would say is that my official title as "counselor" doesn't look real good on a resume, and makes it a little difficult to get another job, especially since we had to do a lot more than most counselors are asked of.

review_title: The most rewarding experience that I've had in an organization, but at the cost of low hours and minimum wage
job_title: Youth Development Professional in Paradise, CA
pros: Engaging Program where staff are trained on a regular basis. Mission statements and Organizational Values are core to the programming and students are placed first and foremost.
cons: Experience differs from site to site and the team you are working with. Some sites have a more intense demographic that you are working with.

review_title: Flexible hours, good job for students

pros: Flexible hours, decent starting pay for a college student, a rewarding job that allows you to work directly within the community
cons: limited staff at most locations, limited activities for children to do during the afterschool program and summer program

review_title: loud  and very disappointed with the people

review_title: Boys and Girls Club of Charlestown
pros: The job is fun and rewarding. Everyone here is easy to get a long with and the kids make all the hard work worth it.
cons: The pay is very low and some times you feel like you are worth more. The hours are from 12-8 so it can be difficult to do actives with friends that work a 9-5.

pros: IT was great place to work very fun and the Youth development specialists we fun to work with. It was great to work in an environment that positively changes children lives
cons: management were terrible, A lot of the YDS were getting fired instead of just providing the staff with extra training. so in a year It was a completely different staff . It was out of control

pros: I get the have fun at work while I help kids become better individuals by teaching them their responsibilities come first.
cons: Many people may see kids always asking them for help everyday as a con but I enjoyed every as a pro because that's what I'm there for

pros:
- You get to work with kids and make a solid impact on their lives. 
- Impact in the community
- Connection with industry leaders from the community
cons:
- Leadership
- Knowing schedules
- Know when kids arrive to the build to plan for programs
- Be more efficient, not waiting to the last minute to make decisions

job_title: Accounts Payable Manager in Atlanta, GA
pros: Its a paycheck until you can find something better.
cons: BGCA does not believe in work life balance. Their pay raises are .5% to 1.5% with no annual bonus. They pay for your insurance premiums but each year the benefits require you to pay more out of pocket. They claim to love the children of America but, they treat the employees horribly and they have children too. If you are looking to grow yourself and be an asset to an organization or company don't waste your time at BGCA.

pros: The kids and the club-level staff are why you come to work. You have the freedom to make a genuine positive impact on a child's life.
cons: The organization changes direction often and does not follow through with any initiatives. It is evident that all decisions are made based on financial gain. The culture  overall does not promote professional development and there is no path for growth within the organization.

pros: "The Movement" as it is referenced, is really strong and is grabs a hold of your soul as you witness the impact of your work on young people's lives around the world. There is not a better youth serving organization to work for in the world.
cons: There are no downsides to working here. You either love the Movement or not.

pros: A very good organization that helps children in need. was very satisfying knowing that i was making an impression on children lives. It was also pretty fun i was an assistant so all i had to do was play games with the children.
cons: Pay was low but its a minimum wage job so it was expected.Management did not treat some of the staff very well.

job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Albuquerque, NM
pros: They will work with your hours if you are a student, also sometimes you can meet some pretty cool kids.
cons: Employees come last. Terrible kids that assault others have no consequences. Administration is out of touch. Under staffed and often times lacking direction for the day.

pros: Working for the Boys & Girls Clubs of America was extremely rewarding, fun, and challenging! This position would be great for someone looking for experience working with children.
cons: This job provides minimal training in working with children - you learn as you go. The compensation is fairly low and would be more appropriate as a secondary income. There isn't a lot of opportunity for growth within the organization.

pros: I started an arts and crafts program at one of the MA Boys and Girls Clubs and had total control over types of art and crafts that were provided to the children. My children wee able to be with me after school.
cons: I started at a good salary and worked part time. However, after a year, due to budget cuts, my pay was cut in half.

pros: Great experience working there at boys and girls club wouldn't fault in anyway.  Best employer every and had fabulous time there
cons: I had no down sides as I was happy with all my experience could not fault in anyway very happy with my position

review_title: You need thick skin to work in Development department
pros: BGCMC overall is a wonderful company who provides much needed programming for it's kids. They do a wonderful job with the kids and the community.
cons: The office culture can be quite intense and some of the Directors can be thoughtless, rude and tormenting. Management style is unhealthy and if you're not prepared to heavily defend yourself and your methods, stay away! They claim they will give you comp time, but they expect 10 hour days plus weekend work during season. So, when exactly is comp time supposed to occur?

review_title: Boys & Girls Club of America is an excellent place to build a career in marketing, non-profit, counseling, & education.
pros: Obviously, the children is the best reward about this GREAT work. And making an impact in the community.
cons: The most challenging aspect would be the parents and club members. Also, one might want to be cautious concerning the essential functions of this company because it's still a place of business.

review_title: Better Upper and middle management is needed

pros:
-I really enjoyed working with the children

review_title: Awesome organization for kids, maybe not for adults
pros:
Ability to give back to the community
Great opportunity to work with kids; learning how to mentor

No cohesive training technique
No support for upward mobility
Most salaries are top-heavy

pros: Working for the Boys and girls club is a great opportunity to do well in the community that surrounds you, just don't expect to get paid a whole lot.
cons: Lack of communication and a very unorganized staff are what make it so difficult to work here. If it weren't for that, it would be a great place to work.

job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Christiansburg, VA
pros: Great managers and a company with an great goal.  Loved my time spent working with children here as a part time employee.
cons: Weird hours, some of site funding is hit or miss so you are the mercy of the school system sometimes.

review_title: Good service-based organization to work with
pros:
- Local clubs can maintain some autonomy while having the support of BGCA
- Work with colleagues who are passionate about what they do
- Lots of opportunities to get involved with your community
cons: - Compensation and benefits need to be more competitive to keep employees as there seems to be high-turnover

pros: Great atmosphere for work and bosses don't constantly look over your shoulder or micromanage. None
cons: I guess if I have to put a negative then it would be that the money is not the greatest but you have to expect that from a non-profit.

pros: Developing young minds of tomorrow. Working with community organizers and community leaders as well as teachers. My experience was awesome because I made it that.
cons: There is a lot of responsibility for such low pay, which is to be expected for a non-profit organization.

pros: Helping the community. Connecting with children. Helping underprivileged kids. What is not to like about that. Every day I would get home and feel accomplished with myself.
cons: Some of the other counselors were obviously just there for the money. It is hard to work with someone who does not put in 100%. Personal was also spread thin.

review_title: Over worked, under paid. Very little room for growth or advancement
pros: Excellent benefits package. Cool coworkers.
cons: No raises ever, I mean never. Giant workload and tons of responsibility for low pay. Constant fear of layoffs due to budget issues.  Very high turnover rate.

pros: Working with children, families, community to make a real difference. Some employees are passionate about what they are doing and how they are contributing.
cons: No training to speak of; zero conflict management skill within the organization; unfortunately, there are a number of folks who are more interested in control and power for their own egos than actually supporting kids and families. Stated mission goals are suffering in the quest for numerical data. Complete lack of trust and honesty from the leadership.

pros: This organization is truly making a difference in some areas. I attended as a child as well.
cons: There can be some tough kids depending where your working but they need people just like any other child and that's why there at the club in the first place.

job_title: Technology Center Director in San Clemente, CA
pros: Great atmosphere, great cause, and typically great to people to work with.  Thus far it has felt the least like a 'job' out of any place that I have worked.
cons: Pay isn't phenomenal, but it is a non-profit so that isn't shocking.  I was part time so I didn't qualify for benefits but they were offered to those that were full time.

pros: The kids are great and full of such high energy. You will definitely never have a bad day there.
cons: You can't really schedule anything for the kids to do. There are too many variables and no strict schedule will stick. You have to be really creative.

review_title: Teen Program Specialist / d2D Case Manager
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Long Beach, CA
pros: The kids you work with are amazing and you have a lot of opportunities to run the program how you want to based on your interests and the interests of the kids you are serving.
cons: Upper level management is not supportive at all.  The program could run much more effectively and have a larger impact if there was more support in place.  The position has unlimited deadlines and requirements and you are not able to complete all necessary tasks as a part-time staff if you want to run a highly effective program.

pros: The kids are always fun to be around and we got to make our own agenda for the kids each day
cons: The facility that I was at was very dirty and unorganized. These clubs should look like they are unkept. Needs new management

pros: Local clubs provide a great opportunity to support kids and teens. So many national partnerships with so much money from national donors.
cons: National office is completely disorganized and poorly managed. High turnover and terrible morale in every department. Unethical financial practices and misuse of funds. Disconnected to what is happening in clubs, poor communication, and terrible follow through. Old boys club and years of experience in senior leadership instead of good leadership training. Seems like everything is just for show with no substance. It looks like they are making a big difference but no one can tell you how outside of number of kids served (which is completely padded with no way to accurately report). Data and evaluation is poorly collected and not accurate of true experience. No voices are valued at any level. (And no use of the Oxford comma!)

pros: If you work at HQ in Atlanta, there is an opportunity to move around to other departments.  The pay and benefits are good compared to other nonprofits.
cons: No opportunities of advancement at the other two regional offices (Chicago and Dallas).  HQ always forgets about the regional offices and telecommuters not in Atlanta for everything!  Poor senior management.  Constant changes and staff turnover.

pros: #BeGreat is the moto where great futures began. The staff and management work well together and allow staff to explore new programs and opportunities.
cons: The need for youth development staff is ongoing and I wish more people would consider working for such a great organization.

job_title: Academic Success Coordinator in Austin, TX
pros: Working hands-on with kids, able to create an impact on their lives every day.
cons: Poor management, lack of quality training, lack of adequate communication. CEO stopped by club only to take pictures with the big check and left, no communication with staff at all.

review_title: Hard, underpaid work in challenged neighborhoods
pros: You really can make a difference in the lives of children who need a place to go and learn and socialize after school.
cons: Very low pay, lack of defined career paths, senior management very insular.

review_title: Amazing mission that unfortunately ends up screwing direct care staff over.
pros: The fact that you get to provide a safe space for youth to grow and be kids is so rewarding and so important for our communities.
cons:
The amount of responsibility I had, for the amount of pay I received was absurd. While I was working for BGCA, I always had this feeling of resentment and I didn't realize why until after I left. 

When I was working as a site coordinator, which is essentially the person who runs and manages a program at an off site location, I had so many responsibilities and so few hours to manage them. I had to manage and supervise my staff, I had to program plan, I had to deal with parent communication, managing child behavior (and I had many difficult behaviors, a lot of the children should not even have been allowed to be there, and this is coming from someone who's career has been working with behavioral children), I had to follow and ensure my staff was following protocols, I had to discipline, all while trying to maintain a safe and growth fostering environment... all for $17 an hour.
 
I also was not provided with time during my scheduled work hours to manage all of these responsibilities. I will say there was never an issue with me adding hours to my time sheet for program planning, they were always happy and willing to compensate my time for the extra hours I put in, which can't be said of most organizations, however... I signed up for a part time 25 hour a week non benefited part time position and usually was putting in 30-35 and I was in school at the time, so I genuinely did not have the time and the program suffered a lot because it, and this made me feel terrible but I was not informed of the immensity of the work I would have to do outside of program hours, that is something that they need to make more clear in the hiring process. I will say that the staff there was all pretty supportive, but there expectations for a part time staff that they aren't paying super well are far too high. 

 I'm a hard worker, but they just asked too much out of me for how much they were giving back to me. I know that they discount many memberships, and do a lot for the community but at my site kids were paying roughly $150 per week for care and our program had about 40 kids, so they were making $6,000 a week off of the program that I ran completely independently from them and I got about $350 bucks a week, that feels like short changing your staff to me. I understand there are overhead costs, but I was also aware of all of the grants and donations they received, they need to pay their staff better IMO.

 It's an organization that is literally run by direct care staff, so to not invest in them is to not invest in your program. Their programming suffers because they are essentially depending on the fact that people will be so emotionally fulfilled by the position that and that their fulfillment will make the job worth it, and listen I love working with children, I love being a positive person in their life, but I also have bills to pay and my own sanity to keep in check. I will say all of the management was super kind and supportive, however at the end of the day I gave so much of myself to that program, and I wasn't compensated fairly and regardless of if their mission is amazing, it's not right.

review_title: Understaffed and underpaid. The new norm.
pros:
Great place for those in or fresh out of high school to get some experience working with kids, if that's aligned with their career goals. Can fit into a school schedule if your afternoons are free. 
Those awesome kids who are the bees-knees.
The awesome parents who are the new wonders of the world and are always there to help, donate supplies or time, back you up when their kid has done something inappropriate, and pay their bills on time.
cons:
Some parents use and abuse the clubs as a discount--or free if they avoid paying their bills--babysitting service. They drop off their kids and drive off before you can do anything about it. This is more something that reception and full-time staff deals with, but I do think it has a negative impact on the children involved and staff morale.
If you already have experience working with kids, the "curriculum" and training workshops might be a snooze fest for you. Over my 2-year stint with them I think I endured the same professional development trainings 3-4 times.
We were asked to do a lot with little to no staff, financial, or resource support.
Just restocking the first aid kit always seemed to be a financial burden, much less getting supplies for art and science projects.
Colleagues come in a wide range of competence. Once, I walked in on another staff playing video games while the kids sat and watched. He considered this to be an "activity". While I and other staff would spend hours putting together forensics labs on our own time,  with our own money, he played video games. And we were paid at the same hourly rate.
Though the company policy is 1 staff to 25 kids, that ratio was often... optimistic.
Seemed to be an awkward "us and them" fmentality between part-time and full-time staff. There seemed to be a lot of company events in which the full-time staff were knowledgeable of, but little or no effort was given to notifying part-time staff.
I was often doing my boss' job, just without the salary and benefits. It was quickly apparent he had no idea what he was doing the majority of the time or he was outright neglecting his duties and I had to pick up the slack.
Don't expect consistent hours. I was working 35 hours a week. I went to work on a normal Monday, and suddenly my hours were cut to 10 a week due to budget issues. So I filled my time with other jobs. Then a few months later they began asking me to pick up additional hours because they were understaffed. At that point, I couldn't as I had already picked up other jobs to supplement my lost hours.
I endured a lot of verbal abuse from disgruntled parents and kids while working at reception. Which is fine to a degree. I get that people are sometimes sensitive where money and child-rearing is concerned. But the emotional stress wasn't worth the depressingly low pay.
